original: @1b #// 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa /
analyzed: @1b #// 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Ten Thousand Lines

original: bam po dgu pa /
analyzed: bam po dgu pa /
translated: PART NINE

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'das pa'i dus la shes pa mi 'jug /🔽ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la shes pa mi 'jug la /🔽dus gsum po dag mi @2a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'das pa'i dus la shes pa mi 'jug / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la shes pa mi 'jug la / dus gsum po dag mi @2a *//
translated: furthermore, the Great Vehicle of bodhisattva great beings is the knowledge that does not engage with the past,🔽the knowledge that does not engage with the future, and the knowledge that does not engage with the present.

original: shes pa'ang ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa'ang ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not that one does not know the three times,🔽but it is that one does not engage with them.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: And that is by way of not apprehending anything.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni /
translated: furthermore, the Great Vehicle of bodhisattva great beings

original: 'dod pa'i khams su shes pa mi 'jug /🔽gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su shes pa mi 'jug la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su shes pa mi 'jug / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su shes pa mi 'jug la /
translated: is the knowledge that does not engage with the desire realm,🔽the knowledge that does not engage with the form realm, and the knowledge that does not engage with the formless realm.

original: khams gsum la mi shes pa'ang mi 'jug pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: khams gsum la mi shes pa'ang mi 'jug pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is not that one does not know the three realms,🔽but it is that one does not engage with them.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: And that is by way of not apprehending anything.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems @2b dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams la shes pa mi 'jug /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems @2b dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams la shes pa mi 'jug /
translated: Moreover, the Mahāyāna of bodhisattva great beings does not engage with the knowledge of mundane phenomena.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams dang / 'dus byas rnams dang / 'dus ma byas rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams la mi shes pa mi 'jug la /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams dang / 'dus byas rnams dang / 'dus ma byas rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams la mi shes pa mi 'jug la /
translated: It does not engage with the ignorance of supramundane phenomena, conditioned phenomena, unconditioned phenomena, phenomena with defilements, or phenomena without defilements.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams la mi shes pa'ang mi 'jug /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams la mi shes pa'ang mi 'jug /
translated: It does not engage with the ignorance of mundane phenomena.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams dang / 'dus byas rnams dang / 'dus ma byas rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams la mi shes pa'ang mi 'jug cing /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams dang / 'dus byas rnams dang / 'dus ma byas rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams la mi shes pa'ang mi 'jug cing /
translated: It does not engage with the knowledge of supramundane phenomena, conditioned phenomena, unconditioned phenomena, phenomena with defilements, or phenomena without defilements.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mi 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mi 'jug pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it does not engage with them in a way that is not based on anything.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,🔽this is the Mahāyāna

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @3a *//🔽gang la gnas na /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @3a *//🔽gang la gnas na /
translated: of bodhisattva great beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa'i theg pa yin te /🔽nyi tshe ba'i theg pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa'i theg pa yin te / nyi tshe ba'i theg pa 'di lta ste /
translated: It is the vehicle for entering into the faultlessness of the bodhisattva.🔽It is not a limited vehicle,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
translated: such as the vehicle of the śrāvakas

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa yin no //
translated: or the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽theg pa chen po'ang gzhan la /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / theg pa chen po'ang gzhan la /
translated: Why is that?🔽The Great Vehicle is not one thing,

original: go cha chen po'ang gzhan ma yin te /🔽go cha chen po nyid theg pa chen po yin la /
analyzed: go cha chen po'ang gzhan ma yin te / go cha chen po nyid theg pa chen po yin la /
translated: and the great armor is not another.🔽The great armor itself is the Great Vehicle,

original: theg pa chen po nyid kyang go cha chen po yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po nyid kyang go cha chen po yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: and the Great Vehicle itself is the great armor.

original: theg pa chen po gang yin pa dang / go cha chen po gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa yin no //
analyzed: theg pa chen po gang yin pa dang / go cha chen po gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa yin no //
translated: The Great Vehicle and the great armor are the faultlessness of the bodhisattva.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatīputra said to the Blessed One:

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems @3b dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes brjod par bgyi lags /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems @3b dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes brjod par bgyi lags /
translated: “By what means is a bodhisattva mahāsattva said to be correctly abiding in the Great Vehicle?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord replied to the venerable Śāradvatī­putra as follows:

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra!

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: Here, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of generosity,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par gnas nas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par gnas nas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'ang mi dmigs /
translated: they correctly abide in the perfection of wisdom and, without apprehending anything, do not apprehend generosity,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / len pa'ang mi dmigs pa dang / de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / len pa'ang mi dmigs pa dang / de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: the perfection of generosity, or the recipient, and likewise, when they practice the perfection of ethical discipline, the perfection of tolerance, the perfection of perseverance,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: When practicing the perfection of meditative stabilization and the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par gnas nas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dge ba'i chos mi dmigs /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par gnas nas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dge ba'i chos mi dmigs /
translated: having perfectly abided in the perfection of wisdom, they do not observe virtuous phenomena,

original: mi dge ba'i chos dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos rnams mi dmigs shing /
translated: they do not observe non-virtuous phenomena, they do not observe neutral phenomena, they do not observe mundane phenomena, they do not observe supramundane phenomena, they do not observe compounded phenomena, they do not observe uncompounded phenomena, they do not observe phenomena with outflows, and they do not observe phenomena without outflows.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa po mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa po mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: They do not observe the perfection of wisdom, they do not observe the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom, and they do not observe the one who cultivates the perfection of wisdom.

original: sh'a @4a *// radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a @4a *// radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: to that extent, the great bodhisattva beings are said to be perfectly abiding in the Great Vehicle.”

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems ma 'dres pas sgom pa rnam par gzhig pa'i ched du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi bsgom ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems ma 'dres pas sgom pa rnam par gzhig pa'i ched du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi bsgom ste /
translated: Moreover, Śāradvatī­putra, great bodhisattva beings, with a mind that is not mixed with anything other than omniscience, cultivate the four applications of mindfulness in order to destroy meditation.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgom mo //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgom mo //
translated: And they cultivate them in a manner free from apprehending anything.

original: de bzhin du sgom pa rnam par gzhig pa'i ched du yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgom pa rnam par gzhig pa'i ched du yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: Similarly, in order to destroy meditation, they cultivate the four correct exertions, the four supports for miraculous ability, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu nas /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu nas /
translated: the three gateways to liberation, and the ten powers of the tathāgatas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du bsgom ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du bsgom ste /
translated: up to and including the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgom mo //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgom mo //
translated: And they cultivate them in a manner free from apprehending anything.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar sgom pa ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar sgom pa ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who meditates in that way is said to be correctly situated in the Great Vehicle.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,🔽further, the bodhisattva mahāsattva thinks, ‘Because the object of mind is nonapprehended,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di snyam du sems pa dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di snyam du sems pa dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: this so-called bodhisattva is just a name and designation.’

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Similarly, this so-called form is just a name.🔽This so-called feeling, perception, and volitional factors are also just names because they are nonapprehended.🔽This so-called consciousness is just a name and designation because it is nonapprehended.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do zhes bya bar @4b shes so //🔽de bzhin du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba 'di ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do zhes bya bar @4b shes so // de bzhin du 'di lta ste /
translated: This so-called eye is just a name and designation because it is nonapprehended.🔽This so-called ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind are just names and designations because they are nonapprehended.🔽This so-called form is just a name and designation because it is nonapprehended.🔽This so-called sound, smell, taste, and tangible object are just names and designations because they are nonapprehended.🔽This so-called sensory element of the eyes is just a name and designation because it is nonapprehended.🔽This so-called sensory element of the ears, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind are just names and designations because they are nonapprehended.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam du zad do //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam du zad do //
translated: This so-called sensory element of form is just a name and designation because it is nonapprehended.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams kyang dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir de bzhin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams kyang dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir de bzhin no //
translated: This so-called sensory element of sound, smell, taste, and tangible object are just names and designations because they are nonapprehended.🔽This so-called sensory element of the eyes is just a name and designation because it is nonapprehended.🔽This so-called sensory element of the ears, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind are just names and designations because they are nonapprehended.

original: rnam par shes pa dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir / 'di lta ste /
translated: This so-called sensory element of visual consciousness is just a name and designation because it is nonapprehended.🔽This so-called sensory element of auditory, olfactory, gustatory, and tactile consciousness are just names and designations because they are nonapprehended.

original: rnam par shes pa 'di ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'di ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do //
translated: This so-called sensory element of mental consciousness is just a name and designation because it is nonapprehended.🔽This so-called sensory element of mental objects is just a name and designation because it is nonapprehended.

original: mig dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: mig dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: This so-called constituent of the eyes is just a name and designation because it is nonapp

original: mig 'di ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do //
analyzed: mig 'di ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do //
translated: This eye is nothing but a name and a label.

original: de bzhin du yid kyi bar du dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi bar du dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: In the same way, the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are not apprehended because they are non-apprehensible.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ces bya ba 'di ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ces bya ba 'di ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do //
translated: Therefore, this—namely, the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind—is nothing but a name and a label.

original: de bzhin du gzugs rnams dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs rnams dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir / 'di lta ste /
translated: Similarly, forms are not apprehended because they are non-apprehensible.

original: gzugs rnams zhes bya ba 'di dag ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do //
analyzed: gzugs rnams zhes bya ba 'di dag ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do //
translated: This—namely, forms—is nothing but a name and a label.

original: de bzhin du sgra dang; dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra dang; dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir / 'di lta ste /
translated: Similarly, sounds, smells, tastes, tangibles, and mental phenomena are not apprehended because they are non-apprehensible.

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams zhes bya ba 'di dag ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do //
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams zhes bya ba 'di dag ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do //
translated: This—namely, sounds, smells, tastes, tangibles, and mental phenomena—is nothing but a name and a label.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: The applications of mindfulness are not apprehended because they are non-apprehensible.🔽This—namely, the applications of mindfulness—is nothing but a name and a label.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi zhes bya ba 'di dag ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi zhes bya ba 'di dag ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do // de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness are merely names and labels.

original: lam gyi bar du dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir /🔽yang dag par spong ba rnams @5a *//
analyzed: lam gyi bar du dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir / yang dag par spong ba rnams @5a *//
translated: In the same vein, the noble eightfold path is non-apprehensible, owing to its utter purity.

original: dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'ang de bzhin no //🔽'di lta ste /🔽nang stong pa nyid nas /🔽dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar de ni dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'ang de bzhin no // 'di lta ste / nang stong pa nyid nas / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar de ni dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path are non-apprehensible, owing to their utter purity.

original: ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do // 'di lta ste /
translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities are non-apprehensible, owing to their utter purity.🔽The emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities are non-apprehensible, owing to their utter purity.🔽The ten powers of the tathāgatas are non-apprehensible, owing to their utter purity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu de dag ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad pa nas /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu de dag ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad pa nas /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great loving kindness, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas are non-apprehensible, owing to their utter purity.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba'i bar de dag ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba'i bar de dag ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do //
translated: up to the qualities of the Buddha are just names and labels.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar du dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar du dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: up to the very limit of reality is not apprehended.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba de ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba de ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do //
translated: suchness, the realm of phenomena, the perfection of phenomena, and the very limit of reality are just names and labels.

original: byang chub dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: byang chub dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Awakening is not apprehended.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: byang chub ces bya ba 'di ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do //
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba 'di ni ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do //
translated: awakening is just a name and a label.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba 'di ni dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba 'di ni dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: It is like this:

original: ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do snyam pa ste /
analyzed: ming dang tha snyad tsam du zad do snyam pa ste /
translated: a perfectly awakened buddha is just a name and a label because of not being apprehended.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang @5b dag par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang @5b dag par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In this way, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva is said to be well-postured in the Great Vehicle.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra!

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, from the first production of the thought of enlightenment onward,

original: nyams pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa lnga yongs su rdzogs par byed /
analyzed: nyams pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa lnga yongs su rdzogs par byed /
translated: perfects the five superknowledges without decline,

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed /
translated: ripens beings,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed /
translated: and purifies the buddhafield.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bkur sti byed /🔽bla mar byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bkur sti byed / bla mar byed /
translated: He goes from buddhafield to buddhafield,

original: ri mor byed /🔽mchod pa byed cing sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las yang dang yang du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ri mor byed / mchod pa byed cing sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las yang dang yang du 'di lta ste /
translated: honoring, venerating, respecting, and worshipping the lord buddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa rab mchog gi theg pa 'di nyid kyi chos kyang nyan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa rab mchog gi theg pa 'di nyid kyi chos kyang nyan to //
translated: and from those lord buddhas he repeatedly hears this very supreme vehicle, the bodhisattva vehicle.

original: theg pa 'di la zhon te /
analyzed: theg pa 'di la zhon te /
translated: Having mounted this vehicle,

original: sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas la blta ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro'ang de phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi 'du shes kyang mi 'byung /
analyzed: sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas la blta ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro'ang de phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi 'du shes kyang mi 'byung /
translated: he goes to the Buddha-fields in order to benefit sentient beings and to see the Buddhas, but he does not have the notion of a Buddha-field,

original: sems can gyi 'du shes dang / sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes kyang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems can gyi 'du shes dang / sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes kyang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: nor the notion of sentient beings, nor the notion of a Buddha.

original: yang de gnyis su med pa'i sa la gnas nas /
analyzed: yang de gnyis su med pa'i sa la gnas nas /
translated: Moreover, having stood in the stage of the non-duality of the two,

original: lus ji snyed kyis sems can rnams kyi don bya ba'i skal ba dang ldan pa de snyed kyi lus yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: lus ji snyed kyis sems can rnams kyi don bya ba'i skal ba dang ldan pa de snyed kyi lus yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: he takes on as many bodies as are necessary to benefit sentient beings.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du nam yang theg pa de dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du nam yang theg pa de dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Until he fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, he is never separated from that vehicle.🔽Having attained the knowledge of all aspects, he is never separated from the knowledge of all aspects.🔽He is never separated from the knowledge of all aspects,

original: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob nas dge sbyong ngam /🔽bram ze'am / lha'am /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob nas dge sbyong ngam / bram ze'am / lha'am /
translated: whether he is a monk,🔽a brahman,🔽a god,🔽a demon,

original: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /
analyzed: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /
translated: a Brahma,

original: gzhan sus kyang ma bskor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur ro //🔽shar phyogs kyi @6a *//
analyzed: gzhan sus kyang ma bskor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur ro // shar phyogs kyi @6a *//
translated: and will turn the wheel of the Dharma that has not been turned by any mendicant, brahmin, god, Māra, Brahmā, or anyone else in the world.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
translated: “In the east, in world systems numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag 'tsho zhing bzhugs pa dang / de bzhin du phyogs mtshams kyi bar gyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na 'tsho zhing bzhugs pa de dag kyang 'jig rten gyi khams che ge mo zhig na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag 'tsho zhing bzhugs pa dang / de bzhin du phyogs mtshams kyi bar gyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na 'tsho zhing bzhugs pa de dag kyang 'jig rten gyi khams che ge mo zhig na /
translated: the blessed buddhas who are alive and present, and likewise in the world systems in the other directions, numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, those who are alive and present, will say:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po che ge mo zhig theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhon nas /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po che ge mo zhig theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhon nas / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob ste /
translated: ‘In such and such a world system, the bodhisattva great being so-and-so, having mounted the Great Vehicle,🔽has attained the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob nas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob nas /
translated: Having attained the knowledge of all aspects,

original: de ltar na gzhan dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan dge sbyong ngam /
translated: in that way, other mendicants, brahmins, gods, Māras, Brahmās, or anyone else in the world,

original: bram ze nas gzhan sus kyang ma bskor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo 'jig rten du bskor ro zhes de'i bsngags pa brjod cing snyan pa sgrogs la dbyangs brjod par mdzad de /
analyzed: bram ze nas gzhan sus kyang ma bskor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo 'jig rten du bskor ro zhes de'i bsngags pa brjod cing snyan pa sgrogs la dbyangs brjod par mdzad de /
translated: He turns the wheel of Dharma in the world, a wheel that no one can turn, not even a brahman or a god or Māra or Brahmā or anyone else.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: in this way the bodhisattva mahāsattva is said to be correctly situated in the Great Vehicle.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s Great Vehicle is the six perfections.

original: drug gang zhe na; 'di lta ste /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na; 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the six?

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: They are the perfection of generosity, the perfection of discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: drug po de dag go /
analyzed: drug po de dag go /
translated: These are the six.

original: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the perfection of generosity?”

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen @6b pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen @6b pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas 'di lta ste /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: nang ngam phyi'i dngos po dag gi sbyin pa de 'dod pa rnams la sbyin par byed cing /
analyzed: nang ngam phyi'i dngos po dag gi sbyin pa de 'dod pa rnams la sbyin par byed cing /
translated: here bodhisattva mahāsattvas, with the thought that is directed toward omniscience, give to those who want inner and outer things,

original: byin nas kyang sbyin pa de sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas /
analyzed: byin nas kyang sbyin pa de sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas /
translated: and having given, they make that generosity common to all beings

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba de ni /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba de ni /
translated: and dedicate it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: that is the bodhisattva mahāsattvas’ perfection of generosity.

original: de la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the perfection of morality?”

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
translated: Here, bodhisattva mahāsattvas, with the generation of the thought that is endowed with omniscience,

original: bdag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs nas legs par spyod la /
analyzed: bdag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs nas legs par spyod la /
translated: having taken up the path of the ten virtuous actions themselves practice it well,

original: gzhan dag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de /
translated: and they also cause others to take up the path of the ten virtuous actions, introduce them to it, and establish them in it.

original: rab tu 'god la de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rab tu 'god la de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed pa 'di ni /
translated: And they do so without apprehending anything.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nag nog med pa'o //
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nag nog med pa'o //
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, this is the unblemished transcendent perfection of ethical discipline maintained by great bodhisattva beings.

original: de la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: “In this regard, what is the transcendent perfection of patience?

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag kyang bzod pa phun sum tshogs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag kyang bzod pa phun sum tshogs pa yin la /
translated: here bodhisattva great beings themselves are endowed with perfect patience,

original: gzhan dag kyang bzod pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god la /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang bzod pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god la /
translated: and they also cause others to take up patience, introduce them to it, and establish them in it.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed pa de ni; sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed pa de ni; sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: and in a way that is free from apprehending anything.🔽

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Moreover, to do so without apprehending anything is the bodhisattva great beings’ perfection of patience.

original: de la brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the perfection of perseverance?

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽'di la byang chub sems dpa' @7a *//
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' @7a *//
translated: Śāriputra,

original: sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
translated: here bodhisattva great beings, with the thought that is the union of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brtson pa mi gtong ba yin /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brtson pa mi gtong ba yin /
translated: do not give up striving for the six perfections.

original: sems can rnams kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god la /🔽de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed pa de ni /🔽sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god la / de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed pa de ni / sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: They also cause sentient beings to take up the six perfections, introduce them to them, and establish them in them.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Moreover, to do so without apprehending anything is the bodhisattva great beings’ perfection of perseverance.🔽What is the perfection of concentration?

original: de la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the perfection of meditation?

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
translated: here bodhisattva great beings, with the thought that is the thought of awakening connected with the knowledge of all aspects,

original: bdag kyang thabs la mkhas pas bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag la snyoms par 'jug cing /
analyzed: bdag kyang thabs la mkhas pas bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag la snyoms par 'jug cing /
translated: through skill in means enter into the meditative stabilizations, the immeasurable aspirations, and the formless absorptions,

original: de dag gi dbang gis kyang mi skye la /
analyzed: de dag gi dbang gis kyang mi skye la /
translated: and they are not reborn under the influence of those meditative stabilizations, immeasurable aspirations, and formless absorptions.

original: gzhan dag kyang bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god la /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god la /
translated: They also cause others to take up those meditative stabilizations, immeasurable aspirations, and formless absorptions, introduce them to them, and establish them in them.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed pa de ni /
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed pa de ni /
translated: And they do so by way of not apprehending anything.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i //
translated: this is the bodhisattva great beings’ perfection of meditation.

original: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the perfection of wisdom?

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
translated: in this regard, great bodhisattva beings, with the mind endowed with omniscience,

original: chos thams @7b cad kyi rang bzhin la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog cing /
analyzed: chos thams @7b cad kyi rang bzhin la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog cing /
translated: analyze the nature of all things just as it is.

original: chos thams cad la'ang mngon par zhen pa med la /
analyzed: chos thams cad la'ang mngon par zhen pa med la /
translated: They do not settle down on any phenomenon,

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed de /
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed de /
translated: and they do so without apprehending anything.

original: chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med nas kyang gzhan dag kyang chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god la /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med nas kyang gzhan dag kyang chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god la /
translated: Without settling down on any phenomenon, they also encourage others to analyze the nature of all things just as it is, and they establish them therein.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed pa de ni /
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed pa de ni /
translated: And they do so without apprehending anything.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: this is the transcendent perfection of wisdom of great bodhisattva beings.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: de'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: de'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po yin no //
translated: That is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatī­putra asked the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /🔽ci sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten pa lags sam /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das / ci sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten pa lags sam /
translated: “Reverend Lord!🔽Is the transcendent perfection of generosity mundane,

original: 'on te 'jig rten las 'das pa lags /
analyzed: 'on te 'jig rten las 'das pa lags /
translated: or is it supramundane?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'ang de lta lags sam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'ang de lta lags sam /
translated: Is it the same for the other transcendent perfections, up to and including the transcendent perfection of wisdom?

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Reverend Lord!

original: gal te sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten pa lags shing /
analyzed: gal te sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten pa lags shing /
translated: If the transcendent perfection of generosity is mundane,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'ang de lta lags na ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'ang de lta lags na ni /
translated: and the other transcendent perfections, up to and including the transcendent perfection of wisdom, are also mundane,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Reverend Lord!

original: ji ltar na 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur lags /
translated: How can the transcendent perfection of generosity, and similarly, the other transcendent perfections, up to and including the transcendent perfection of wisdom, be perfected in a mundane manner?

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jig rten pa ni 'dus byas lags la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ni 'dus byas lags la /
translated: Worldly is conditioned,

original: 'dus byas gang lags pa de ni mi rtag pa @8a *//
analyzed: 'dus byas gang lags pa de ni mi rtag pa @8a *//
translated: and whatever is conditioned is impermanent.

original: lags na / mi rtag pa gang lags pa de ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: lags na / mi rtag pa gang lags pa de ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur lags /
translated: How could that which is impermanent complete the perfections?

original: ci ste sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten las 'das pa lags shing /
analyzed: ci ste sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten las 'das pa lags shing /
translated: If the perfection of giving is supramundane,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'ang de lta lags na ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'ang de lta lags na ni /
translated: and so too up to the perfection of wisdom,

original: de ni byed pa ma mchis pa lags la /
analyzed: de ni byed pa ma mchis pa lags la /
translated: then it is without activity.

original: byed pa ma mchis pa gang lags pa de ji ltar yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur lags /🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to /
analyzed: byed pa ma mchis pa gang lags pa de ji ltar yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur lags / de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to /
translated: How could that which is without activity complete it?

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa'ang yod /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa'ang yod /
translated: The Lord said, “Śāriputra,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang yod /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang yod /
translated: the perfection of giving is both worldly and supramundane.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the perfections of morality, patience, perseverance, and concentration.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang 'jig rten pa'ang yod /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang 'jig rten pa'ang yod /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is also of two kinds:

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang yod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang yod do //
translated: mundane and supramundane.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten pa ni gang lags /
translated: “What is the mundane perfection of giving?

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten las 'das pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'jig rten las 'das pa ni gang lags /
translated: What is the supramundane perfection of giving?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin phong pa sbyin bdag tu gyur pa de dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / bkren pa dang / 'dron pa dang / sdug 'phongs pa dang / slong ba rnams @8b la zas 'dod pa dag la zas sbyin par byed /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin phong pa sbyin bdag tu gyur pa de dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / bkren pa dang / 'dron pa dang / sdug 'phongs pa dang / slong ba rnams @8b la zas 'dod pa dag la zas sbyin par byed /
translated: here a bodhisattva mahāsattva, a giver, a benefactor, gives food to those who want food,

original: skom 'dod pa dag la skom sbyin par byed pa nas /
analyzed: skom 'dod pa dag la skom sbyin par byed pa nas /
translated: to those who want drink, he gives drink.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way, he gives clothes,

original: gos dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / khyim 'dod pa'i bar dag la sbyin par byed pa dang / gnas 'dod pa dag la /
analyzed: gos dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / khyim 'dod pa'i bar dag la sbyin par byed pa dang / gnas 'dod pa dag la /
translated: incense, garlands, ointments, bedding, seats, and houses to those who want them.

original: gnas sbyin par byed cing /
analyzed: gnas sbyin par byed cing /
translated: To those who want a place to stay, he gives a place to stay.

original: sman 'dod pa rnams la sman /
analyzed: sman 'dod pa rnams la sman /
translated: To those who want medicine, he gives medicine.🔽To those who want necessities, he gives necessities.🔽In the same way, he gives whatever human necessities are appropriate to beggars.

original: yo byad 'dod pa rnams la yo byad sbyin par byed pa dang / de bzhin du slong ba rnams la mi'i yo byad gang yang rung bdag sbyin par byed pa dang / de bzhin du bu pho sbyin par byed pa dang / bu mo sbyin par byed pa dang /
analyzed: yo byad 'dod pa rnams la yo byad sbyin par byed pa dang / de bzhin du slong ba rnams la mi'i yo byad gang yang rung bdag sbyin par byed pa dang / de bzhin du bu pho sbyin par byed pa dang / bu mo sbyin par byed pa dang /
translated: In the same way, he gives sons, daughters,🔽wives, and retinues of concubines.

original: chung ma dang / slas kyi 'khor dag sbyin par byed pa dang / de bzhin du mgo dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / rkang pa dang / lag pa dang / yan lag dang / nying lag dag sbyin par byed cing /
analyzed: chung ma dang / slas kyi 'khor dag sbyin par byed pa dang / de bzhin du mgo dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / rkang pa dang / lag pa dang / yan lag dang / nying lag dag sbyin par byed cing /
translated: In the same way, he gives his head, eyes, ears, nose, legs, arms, major and minor body parts.

original: de dag kyang dngos po'i bdag nyid du gnas nas yongs su gtong bar byed la /
analyzed: de dag kyang dngos po'i bdag nyid du gnas nas yongs su gtong bar byed la /
translated: They give them away while remaining in the nature of things.

original: de 'di snyam du'ang sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du'ang sems te /
translated: And they think as follows:

original: bdag ni sbyin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni sbyin par byed pa'o //
translated: “I am the one who gives.

original: 'di dag ni len par byed pa dag go /
analyzed: 'di dag ni len par byed pa dag go /
translated: These are the ones who receive.

original: kye bdag ni ser sna med pa'o //🔽bdag ni sbyin bdag yin no //
analyzed: kye bdag ni ser sna med pa'o // bdag ni sbyin bdag yin no //
translated: Oh, I am not stingy.🔽I am a patron.

original: bdag ni slong mo ster ba'o //
analyzed: bdag ni slong mo ster ba'o //
translated: I am the one who gives alms.

original: kye bdag ni thams cad yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: kye bdag ni thams cad yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: Oh, I give everything away.

original: bdag ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bkur sti byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bkur sti byed pa'o //
translated: I honor the Blessed Buddhas.

original: bdag ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: bdag ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: I practice the perfection of generosity.

original: sbyin pa de byin nas kyang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa de byin nas kyang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas /
translated: And having given that gift, they make it common to all sentient beings,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su @9a *//
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su @9a *//
translated: and dedicate it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,🔽without taking anything as a basis.

original: bsngo bar byed cing /
analyzed: bsngo bar byed cing /
translated: And they think,

original: bdag gi sbyin pa 'dis sems can thams cad tshe 'di nyid la bde bar gyur cig /
analyzed: bdag gi sbyin pa 'dis sems can thams cad tshe 'di nyid la bde bar gyur cig /
translated: “By this generosity of mine, may all sentient beings be happy in this very life.

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur cig snyam mo //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur cig snyam mo //
translated: and may they pass into complete nirvāṇa in the realm of nirvāṇa without any remainder of the skandhas.

original: de ni chags pa gsum la chags shing sbyin pa de sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: de ni chags pa gsum la chags shing sbyin pa de sbyin par byed de /
translated: “They give gifts while attached to three attachments.

original: gsum po gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: 'di lta ste; bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / gzhan du 'du shes pa dang / sbyin par 'du shes pa ste /🔽chags pa gsum po de dag la chags nas /
analyzed: 'di lta ste; bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / gzhan du 'du shes pa dang / sbyin par 'du shes pa ste / chags pa gsum po de dag la chags nas /
translated: Namely, the notion of self, the notion of other, and the notion of giving.

original: sbyin pa de sbyin par byed pa de ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa de sbyin par byed pa de ni /
translated: They give gifts while attached to these three attachments.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the mundane perfection of generosity.

original: ci'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the mundane perfection of generosity?

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten dang lhan cig tu spyod cing /🔽'jig rten las mi g-yo la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten dang lhan cig tu spyod cing / 'jig rten las mi g-yo la /
translated: Because it is practiced together with the world,🔽it does not move from the world,

original: yang dag par mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: yang dag par mi 'da' ste /
translated: and it does not transcend the world.

original: rgyu des na 'jig rten pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu des na 'jig rten pa zhes bya'o //
translated: For this reason it is called ‘mundane.’

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the transcendent perfection of generosity?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The complete purity of the three spheres.

original: de la kye byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin pa'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: de la kye byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin pa'ang mi dmigs /
translated: In this regard, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, with a mind preceded by great compassion, does not apprehend generosity,

original: sbyin pa po'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: sbyin pa po'ang mi dmigs /
translated: does not apprehend the giver,

original: len pa po'ang mi dmigs /🔽sbyin pa'ang ma yin la /
analyzed: len pa po'ang mi dmigs / sbyin pa'ang ma yin la /
translated: does not apprehend the recipient,

original: sbyin pa de'i rnam par smin pa'ang mngon par dga' ba med pa de ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa de'i rnam par smin pa'ang mngon par dga' ba med pa de ni /
translated: and is not attached to the maturation of that generosity.

original: sh'a @9b radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a @9b radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: this is called the complete purity of the three spheres.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad la sbyin pa sbyin zhing /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can thams cad la sbyin pa sbyin zhing /
translated: further, the bodhisattva mahāsattva gives gifts to all sentient beings,

original: byin nas kyang sems can de dag nyid la gtong yang sems can de dag kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: byin nas kyang sems can de dag nyid la gtong yang sems can de dag kyang mi dmigs /
translated: and having given, he dedicates them to those very sentient beings, but he does not apprehend those sentient beings,

original: len pa po'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: len pa po'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: and he does not consider the recipient.

original: sbyin pa de'i rnam par smin pa la'ang mngon par dga' ba med la /
analyzed: sbyin pa de'i rnam par smin pa la'ang mngon par dga' ba med la /
translated: They do not delight in the maturation of that generosity.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu'ang yongs su bsngo mod kyi /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu'ang yongs su bsngo mod kyi /
translated: They dedicate it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: mtshan ma phra rab tsam yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma phra rab tsam yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de ni /
translated: But they do not see even the subtlest sign.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu; 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu; 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Śāriputra, that is called the perfection of generosity that transcends the world.

original: de ci'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called ‘that which transcends the world’?

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten las brgal zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten las brgal zhing /
translated: It is because it goes beyond the world,

original: 'jig rten las 'phags la /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'phags la /
translated: it is exalted above the world,

original: 'jig rten las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: it is completely beyond the world.

original: de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the perfection of generosity that transcends the world.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽gnas pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te / gnas pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa yin la /
translated: And so on.🔽The perfection of morality that is based is mundane.

original: mi gnas pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: mi gnas pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: The perfection of morality that is not based is supramundane.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par ji skad bstan pa de kho na bzhin du rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par ji skad bstan pa de kho na bzhin du rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood in the same way as the perfection of generosity was explained.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la'ang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la'ang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied to the perfection of patience, the perfection of effort, and the perfection of meditation.

original: gnas pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol @10a *//🔽tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa yin la /
analyzed: gnas pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol @10a *// tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa yin la /
translated: The perfection of wisdom that is based is🔽mundane.

original: mi gnas pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom that is not based is supramundane.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: in this way the bodhisattva mahāsattva perfects the mundane and supramundane perfection of generosity.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: The same should be applied up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'ang / sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: de'ang / sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po dang / go cha chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po dang / go cha chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa yin no //
translated: It is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings, the great armor, and the bodhisattva’s faultlessness.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri ba las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri ba las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Ten Thousand Lines,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ste dgu pa'o ////🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das la /🔽tshe dang ldan rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ste dgu pa'o //// de nas bcom ldan 'das la / tshe dang ldan rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: this is chapter nine, “Teaching the Perfections.”🔽Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Subhūti,🔽how much is it that you have been taught by the Tathāgata,

original: ji tsam gyis na go cha chen po bgos pa /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na go cha chen po bgos pa /
translated: that you have been taught the great armor,

original: go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bgyi ba lags /
analyzed: go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bgyi ba lags /
translated: and that you have been taught the great vehicle?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha bgos /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha bgos /
translated: “Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being who dons the armor of the perfection of generosity,

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar gyi go cha bgos /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar gyi go cha bgos /
translated: and similarly dons the armor of the perfection of wisdom,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i go cha bgos /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i go cha bgos /
translated: He dons the armor of the applications of mindfulness.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i @10b bar gyi go cha bgos /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i @10b bar gyi go cha bgos /
translated: He dons the armor of the noble eightfold path.

original: nang stong pa nyid kyi go cha bgos /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyi go cha bgos /
translated: He dons the armor of inner emptiness.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi go cha bgos /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi go cha bgos /
translated: He dons the armor of up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i go cha bgos /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i go cha bgos /
translated: He dons the armor of the ten powers of the tathāgatas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi go cha bgos /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi go cha bgos /
translated: He dons the armor of up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi go cha bgos /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi go cha bgos /
translated: He dons the armor of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku'i go cha bgos nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku'i go cha bgos nas /
translated: Having donned the armor of the buddha body,

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bas khyab par byed do //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bas khyab par byed do //
translated: he illuminates the world systems of the great trichiliocosm.

original: de bzhin du shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag snang bas khyab par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag snang bas khyab par byed do //
translated: In the same way, he illuminates the world systems of the eastern direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river.

original: de bzhin du phyogs mtshams kyi bar gyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag snang bas khyab par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs mtshams kyi bar gyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag snang bas khyab par byed do //
translated: In the same way, he fills with light the world systems in all ten directions, as many as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River.🔽Having filled them with light, he causes the great trichiliocosm to shake in six ways.

original: khyab par byas nas kyang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa drug tu g-yo bar byed /🔽rab tu g-yo bar byed /
analyzed: khyab par byas nas kyang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa drug tu g-yo bar byed / rab tu g-yo bar byed /
translated: He causes it to shake, to shake strongly, and to shake intensely.🔽He causes it to move, to move strongly, and to move intensely.🔽He causes it to stir, to stir strongly, and to stir intensely.🔽He causes it to roar, to roar strongly, and to roar intensely.

original: kun tu rab tu g-yo bar byed do //
analyzed: kun tu rab tu g-yo bar byed do //
translated: He causes it to quake, to quake strongly, and to quake intensely.🔽In the same way, he causes the world systems in all ten directions, as many as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River, to shake in six ways.

original: de bzhin du shar phyogs nas phyogs mtshams kyi bar gyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag rnam pa drug tu g-yo bar byed /🔽rab tu g-yo bar byed /
analyzed: de bzhin du shar phyogs nas phyogs mtshams kyi bar gyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag rnam pa drug tu g-yo bar byed / rab tu g-yo bar byed /
translated: He causes them to shake, to shake strongly, and to shake intensely.🔽He causes them to move, to move strongly, and to move intensely.🔽He causes them to stir, to stir strongly, and to stir intensely.🔽He causes them to roar, to roar strongly, and to roar intensely.

original: kun tu rab tu g-yo bar byed do //
analyzed: kun tu rab tu g-yo bar byed do //
translated: He causes them to quake, to quake strongly, and to quake intensely.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de snang ba des kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha bgos pa nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de snang ba des kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha bgos pa nas /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva, with that light, dons the armor of the perfection of generosity,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku'i bar gyi go cha bgos pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku'i bar gyi go cha bgos pa yin no //
translated: up to dons the armor of the buddha body.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams bee d'urya'i rang bzhin du mngon par sprul par byed do //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams bee d'urya'i rang bzhin du mngon par sprul par byed do //
translated: He emanates a great trichiliocosm made of beryl.

original: mngon par @11a *//🔽sprul nas kyang 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i bkod pa mngon par sprul par byed cing /
analyzed: mngon par @11a *// sprul nas kyang 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i bkod pa mngon par sprul par byed cing /
translated: Having emanated it,🔽he emanates the array of a universal monarch.

original: des 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i bkod pa mngon par sprul nas kyang zas 'dod pa rnams la zas sbyin par byed /
analyzed: des 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i bkod pa mngon par sprul nas kyang zas 'dod pa rnams la zas sbyin par byed /
translated: Having emanated the array of a universal monarch, he gives food to those who want food.

original: de bzhin du btung ba nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du btung ba nas /
translated: Similarly, he gives drink,

original: gos dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / khang pa dang / gnas dang / mar me dang / sman du sbyar ba dang / sman gyi bar du sbyin par byed pa dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: gos dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / khang pa dang / gnas dang / mar me dang / sman du sbyar ba dang / sman gyi bar du sbyin par byed pa dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and so on up to

original: mi'i yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar dag sems can dag la sbyin par byed cing /
analyzed: mi'i yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar dag sems can dag la sbyin par byed cing /
translated: he gives whatever human necessities there are to sentient beings.

original: des sbyin pa de lta bu byin nas /
analyzed: des sbyin pa de lta bu byin nas /
translated: Having given such gifts,

original: sems can de dag nyid la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can de dag nyid la 'di lta ste /
translated: he teaches those very sentient beings the Dharma as follows:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa'i chos 'di dag nyid kyi chos ston to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa'i chos 'di dag nyid kyi chos ston to //
translated: they teach the Dharma endowed with the six perfections.

original: sems can de dag kyang chos de thos nas /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang chos de thos nas /
translated: And those sentient beings, having heard that Dharma,

original: nam yang log par ltung bar mi ltung la /
analyzed: nam yang log par ltung bar mi ltung la /
translated: never fall to the lower realms,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du nam yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du nam yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: and until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood, they are never separated from the six perfections.

original: rab 'byor / de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, it is in this way that a bodhisattva great being is said to be wearing the great armor.

original: rab 'byor / dper na /🔽sgyu ma mkhan nam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:🔽a magician or a magician’s apprentice,

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis lam po che'i bzhi mdor 'dug ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis lam po che'i bzhi mdor 'dug ste /
translated: having sat down at a crossroads in a town,

original: skye bo phal po che'i mdun du zas 'dod pa dag la zas sbyin pa nas /
analyzed: skye bo phal po che'i mdun du zas 'dod pa dag la zas sbyin pa nas /
translated: having given food to those who want food,

original: mi'i yo byad gang yang rung ba'i @11b bar du byin na /
analyzed: mi'i yo byad gang yang rung ba'i @11b bar du byin na /
translated: up to having given any human necessities,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: ci sgyu ma'i skyes bu'am /
analyzed: ci sgyu ma'i skyes bu'am /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti,

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob mas sems can gang la'ang sbyin pa byin pa yod snyam mam /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob mas sems can gang la'ang sbyin pa byin pa yod snyam mam /
translated: did the illusory person or the magician’s apprentice give any gift to any being?”

original: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “No, Blessed One.

original: ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: ma mchis lags so //
translated: No, Sugata.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i bkod pa mngon par sprul nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i bkod pa mngon par sprul nas /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, when bodhisattva great beings emanate the array of a universal monarch

original: zas 'dod pa dag la zas sbyin par byed pa nas /
analyzed: zas 'dod pa dag la zas sbyin par byed pa nas /
translated: and give food to those who want food,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and so on,

original: mi'i yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar dag sbyin par byed kyang sems can gang la'ang sbyin pa ci'ang byin pa med do //
analyzed: mi'i yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar dag sbyin par byed kyang sems can gang la'ang sbyin pa ci'ang byin pa med do //
