translated: giving them whatever human necessities they need, they do not give any gift to any being at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /
translated: Because, considering the intrinsic nature of an illusion,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is the intrinsic nature of phenomena.”

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of morality

original: bsam bzhin du skye ba yongs su bzung bas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i rigs su skye ste /
analyzed: bsam bzhin du skye ba yongs su bzung bas 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i rigs su skye ste /
translated: take up a birth as they wish, and so are born into a kṣatriya universal monarch family.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rigs kyi dbang phyug de la gnas nas /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rigs kyi dbang phyug de la gnas nas /
translated: Standing in the sovereignty of a universal monarch family,

original: sems can bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dag dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la 'god par byed /
analyzed: sems can bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dag dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la 'god par byed /
translated: they establish many hundred thousand one hundred million billion beings in the ten wholesome actions.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag la 'god par byed /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag la 'god par byed /
translated: Similarly, they establish them in the four concentrations, four immeasurables, and four formless absorptions.

original: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽'phags pa'i @12a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / de bzhin du sbyar te / 'phags pa'i @12a *//
translated: Similarly, they establish them in the four establishments of mindfulness, and in the same way

original: lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu nas /
analyzed: lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu nas /
translated: they establish them in the eightfold noble path, three gateways to liberation, and similarly in the ten tathāgata powers,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la 'god par byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la 'god par byed de /
translated: and establishes them in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: sems can de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du nam yang chos bstan pa de dag dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du nam yang chos bstan pa de dag dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and those sentient beings never again become separated from those teachings until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: rab 'byor / dper na /🔽sgyu ma mkhan nam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:🔽a magician or a magician’s apprentice

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis skye bo'i tshogs chen po zhig mngon par sprul nas /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis skye bo'i tshogs chen po zhig mngon par sprul nas /
translated: might conjure up a large crowd of people

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod /
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod /
translated: and establish them in the ten virtuous actions,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and in the same vein,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la bkod na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la bkod na /
translated: establish them in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽ci sgyu ma'i skyes bu'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems / ci sgyu ma'i skyes bu'am /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think of this?

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma des de la sems can 'ga' yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa yod snyam mam /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma des de la sems can 'ga' yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa yod snyam mam /
translated: Would that illusory person or that magician’s apprentice have established any sentient beings in the ten virtuous actions?

original: de bzhin du sbyar te; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la bkod pa yod snyam mam /🔽gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la bkod pa yod snyam mam / gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: …in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha?

original: ma mchis lags so //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: ma mchis lags so // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: Subhūti replied, “No, Blessed One.”

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sems can bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dag dge ba bcu'i las @12b kyi lam la bkod pa de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sems can bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dag dge ba bcu'i las @12b kyi lam la bkod pa de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti, in the same way, although bodhisattva great beings have established many hundred thousand one hundred million billion beings in the ten wholesome actions, and so on, up to

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la bkod kyang sems can 'ga' yang bkod pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la bkod kyang sems can 'ga' yang bkod pa med do //
translated: although they have established them in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, they have not established any beings at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: rab 'byor / sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /
translated: Subhūti, it is because, when you take the reality of an illusion as your point of reference,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid de yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid de yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: that is the reality of phenomena.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, that is why a bodhisattva great being is said to be wearing the great armor.”

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of patience

original: sems can bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum dag bzod pa la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: sems can bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum dag bzod pa la 'god par byed do //
translated: establish a hundred thousand one hundred million billion beings in patience.

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of patience

original: sems can bye pa khrag khrig phrag 'bum dag bzod pa la 'god par byed ce na /
analyzed: sems can bye pa khrag khrig phrag 'bum dag bzod pa la 'god par byed ce na /
translated: establish a hundred thousand one hundred million billion beings in patience?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings starting from the first production of the thought,

original: go cha 'di ltar gyon par byed de /
analyzed: go cha 'di ltar gyon par byed de /
translated: having put on this armor,

original: gal te sems can thams cad 'ongs nas /
analyzed: gal te sems can thams cad 'ongs nas /
translated: if all beings were to come and

original: bdag la dbyug pa dang / mtshon cha dang / bong ba dag gis bsnun kyang de la bdag gis sems can gang la'ang 'khrug pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa 'ga' yang skyed par mi bya'i /
analyzed: bdag la dbyug pa dang / mtshon cha dang / bong ba dag gis bsnun kyang de la bdag gis sems can gang la'ang 'khrug pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa 'ga' yang skyed par mi bya'i /
translated: beat me with sticks, swords, and clods of earth, I would not produce even one thought of disturbed mind toward any being.

original: bdag gis sems can thams cad kyang bzod pa de lta bu la dgod par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can thams cad kyang bzod pa de lta bu la dgod par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: I should establish all sentient beings in that kind of patience.

original: des go cha de lta bu bgos nas dgra bo dang phyir rgol ba dag gis @13a *//
analyzed: des go cha de lta bu bgos nas dgra bo dang phyir rgol ba dag gis @13a *//
translated: Having donned that kind of armor, even if enemies and adversaries

original: bong ba dang / dbyug pa dang / mtshon gyis gdab pa dag gis nyon mongs na'ang nam yang sems can gang la'ang 'khrug pa dang ldan pa'i sems mi skyed kyi /
analyzed: bong ba dang / dbyug pa dang / mtshon gyis gdab pa dag gis nyon mongs na'ang nam yang sems can gang la'ang 'khrug pa dang ldan pa'i sems mi skyed kyi /
translated: afflict him with clods, sticks, and weapons, he never gives rise to a thought that is disturbed with regard to any sentient being.

original: sems can bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum dag bzod pa de lta bu la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: sems can bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum dag bzod pa de lta bu la 'god par byed do //
translated: He establishes a hundred thousand quintillion sentient beings in that kind of patience.

original: rab 'byor / dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dper na /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: sgyu ma mkhan nam /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan nam /

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis skye bo'i tshogs chen po zhig mngon par sprul nas sems can bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum dag bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bkod na /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis skye bo'i tshogs chen po zhig mngon par sprul nas sems can bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum dag bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bkod na /
translated: having conjured up a great crowd of people, establishes a hundred thousand quintillion sentient beings in the perfection of patience.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: What do you think, Subhūti?

original: ci sgyu ma'i skyes bu'am /
analyzed: ci sgyu ma'i skyes bu'am /

analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma des de la sems can 'ga' yang bzod pa la bkod pa yod snyam mam / gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The magician's apprentice thinks, I have established many hundreds of thousands of sentient beings in patience.

original: ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: ma mchis lags so //
translated: He replies, No, Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One says, Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sems can bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dag bzod pa la bkod kyang sems can 'ga' yang bkod pa med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sems can bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dag bzod pa la bkod kyang sems can 'ga' yang bkod pa med do //
translated: in the same way, although the bodhisattva great being has established many hundred thousands of niyutas of koṭis of sentient beings in patience, he has not established any sentient beings at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / sgyu ma'i chos nyid de nye bar bzung na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sgyu ma'i chos nyid de nye bar bzung na /
translated: Subhūti, it is because, taking the dharmatā of illusions as an example,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid de yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid de yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: that is the dharmatā of dharmas.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, in that way the bodhisattva great being is said to be wearing the great armor.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub @13b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub @13b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: Subhūti, furthermore, the bodhisattva great being, standing in the perfection of perseverance,

original: sems can bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum dag brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god par byed /
analyzed: sems can bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum dag brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god par byed /
translated: and cause many hundred thousand of niyutas of koṭis of beings to take up, enter into, and progress in the perfection of perseverance.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis mi dge ba'i chos spang ba'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos phun sum tshogs par bya ba'i phyir sems can de dag lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god par byed do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis mi dge ba'i chos spang ba'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos phun sum tshogs par bya ba'i phyir sems can de dag lus dang sems kyi brtson 'grus yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god par byed do //
translated: With a thought endowed with the knowledge of all modes they cause those beings to take up, enter into, and progress in physical and mental perseverance in order to get rid of unwholesome dharmas and to perfect wholesome dharmas.

original: rab 'byor / dper na /🔽sgyu ma mkhan nam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
translated: For example, Subhuti,

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis skye bo'i tshogs chen po zhig mngon par sprul nas /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis skye bo'i tshogs chen po zhig mngon par sprul nas /
translated: a magician or magician's apprentice, having conjured up a great crowd of beings,

original: sems can bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum dag brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god par byed na /
analyzed: sems can bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum dag brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god par byed na /
translated: and caused many hundred thousand of niyutas of kotis of beings to take up, enter into, and progress in the perfection of perseverance,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽ci sgyu ma'i skyes bu'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems / ci sgyu ma'i skyes bu'am /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma des de la sems can 'ga' yang brtson 'grus la bkod pa yod dam /🔽gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma des de la sems can 'ga' yang brtson 'grus la bkod pa yod dam / gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Are there any beings at all whom the illusory person or the magician's apprentice has established in perseverance?

original: ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: ma mchis lags so //
translated: He replied, No, Lord.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sems can bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dag brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bkod kyang sems can 'ga' yang bkod pa med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sems can bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dag brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bkod kyang sems can 'ga' yang bkod pa med do //
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, although bodhisattva great beings have established many hundred thousand koṭis of niyutas of beings in the perfection of perseverance, they have not established any beings at all.

original: de ci'i phyir @14a *//🔽zhe na / rab 'byor /🔽sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir @14a *// zhe na / rab 'byor / sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid de yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid de yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Subhūti, it is because, when you take the true nature of illusions as an analogy, that is the true nature of dharmas.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, in that way, bodhisattva great beings are said to be wearing the great armor.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, abiding in the perfection of concentration,

original: sems can bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum dag bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god par byed do //
analyzed: sems can bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum dag bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god par byed do //
translated: cause a hundred thousand quintillion sentient beings to take up the perfection of concentration, introduce them to it, and establish them in it.

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /

analyzed: sems can bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum dag bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god par byed ce na /

analyzed: chos gang yang mnyam par bzhag pa'am /

analyzed: rnam par g-yeng bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /

translated: They cause those sentient beings to take up and enter into that meditative stabilization and they establish them in it.

analyzed: / rab tu 'god par byed do //
translated: They cause them to take it up and enter into it and they establish them in it in such a way that they will never be separated from the perfection of meditative stabilization until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: rab 'byor / dper na /🔽sgyu ma mkhan nam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
translated: Subhūti, it is just as if🔽a magician or a magician’s apprentice

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i par la gnas te /
translated: up to and dwell in the perfection of wisdom.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god par byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god par byed do //
translated: They cause them to take up the perfection of giving, introduce them to it, and establish them in it.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha @16a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha @16a *//
translated: Similarly, they cause them to take up the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience,🔽the perfection of perseverance,🔽the perfection of concentration,🔽and the perfection of wisdom, introduce them to it, and establish them in it.

original: rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god par byed cing /🔽sems can de dag la rtag tu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god par byed cing / sems can de dag la rtag tu 'di lta ste /
translated: and the perfection of wisdom, and he introduces them to the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom, and he establishes them in them.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag nyid kyi chos ston to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag nyid kyi chos ston to //
translated: And he always teaches them the Dharma, namely, this very perfection of wisdom.

original: sems can de dag kyang chos de thos nas /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang chos de thos nas /
translated: And those beings, having heard this Dharma,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du nam yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas kyi bar du nam yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: will never again be deprived of the six perfections until they have fully known the utmost, right, and perfect enlightenment.

original: shar phyogs su ji skad bstan pa bzhin du phyogs bcu kun du sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: shar phyogs su ji skad bstan pa bzhin du phyogs bcu kun du sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as in the eastern direction, so in all the ten directions, in as many world systems as there are sands in the Ganges river, in all of them he introduces beings to the perfections, and he establishes them in them.

original: rab 'byor / dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dper na /
translated: For example, Subhuti,

original: sgyu ma mkhan nam /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan nam /
translated: a magician,

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du ji ltar le'u dang por dpe dang bcas par bstan pa de kho na bzhin du 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du ji ltar le'u dang por dpe dang bcas par bstan pa de kho na bzhin du 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: or a skilled magician’s apprentice, and so on, and in the same way as it was explained in the first chapter with the example, here too it should be connected in the same way as before.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, in that way a bodhisattva great being is said to be wearing the great armor.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po 'di bgos nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po 'di bgos nas /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being wearing this great armor

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis gnas pa na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis gnas pa na /
translated: dwells with a mind endowed with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sems bskyed pa gzhan nyan @16b thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems bskyed pa dag gi skabs mi 'byed la /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa gzhan nyan @16b thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems bskyed pa dag gi skabs mi 'byed la /
translated: He does not create an opportunity for the thought of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas to arise.

original: de 'di snyam du bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la dgod par bya'o;/
analyzed: de 'di snyam du bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la dgod par bya'o;/
translated: He thinks, ‘I will establish this many sentient beings in the perfection of generosity.

original: sems can 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sems can 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: I will not establish this many sentient beings in the perfection of wisdom.🔽I will establish this many sentient beings in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la dgod par bya'o //🔽'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba snga ma kho na bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la dgod par bya'o // 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba snga ma kho na bzhin no //
translated: I will not establish this many sentient beings in the perfection of wisdom.🔽I will establish this many sentient beings in the applications of mindfulness,

original: de bzhin du bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang /
translated: the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po dag la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po dag la dgod par bya'o //
translated: the noble eightfold path, and the three doors of liberation.

original: sems can 'di snyed cig ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi bar dag la dgod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sems can 'di snyed cig ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi bar dag la dgod par mi bya'o //
translated: I will not establish this many sentient beings in the three doors of liberation.

original: de bzhin du bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu nas /
translated: In the same way, I will establish this many sentient beings in the ten powers of the tathāgatas, and so on, up to

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish this many sentient beings in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: 'di snyed cig ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la dgod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di snyed cig ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la dgod par mi bya'o //
translated: I will not establish this many sentient beings in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de bzhin du bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya'o //🔽lan gcig phyir 'ong @17a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya'o // lan gcig phyir 'ong @17a *//
translated: In the same way, I will establish this many sentient beings in the result of stream enterer,

original: ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub la dgod par bya'o //
translated: and in the result of once-returner, and in the result of non-returner, and in the state of a worthy one, and in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.

original: de bzhin du bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni rang byang chub kyi bar la dgod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni rang byang chub kyi bar la dgod par mi bya'o //
translated: I will not establish this many sentient beings in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.

original: de bzhin du bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dgod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, I will establish this many sentient beings in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o snyam du mi sems kyi /
analyzed: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o snyam du mi sems kyi /
translated: He does not think, “I will not establish this many in the perfection of giving,🔽but I will establish this many in the perfection of giving.”

original: rab 'byor / de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Subhūti, he thinks like this:

original: bdag gis sems can dpag tu med cing grangs med pa dag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can dpag tu med cing grangs med pa dag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la dgod par bya'o //
translated: “I will establish countless, immeasurable sentient beings in the perfection of giving.🔽Similarly, I will establish them in the perfection of wisdom,

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽bdag gis sems can dpag tu med /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / de bzhin du sbyar te / bdag gis sems can dpag tu med /
translated: and in the applications of mindfulness, and in the same vein as before,

original: grangs med pa'i bar dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dgod par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: grangs med pa'i bar dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dgod par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: I will establish countless, immeasurable sentient beings in the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: rab 'byor / dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is just as

original: sgyu ma mkhan nam /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan nam /
translated: a magician or

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhes bya ba nas /🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhes bya ba nas / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: a magician’s skilled apprentice🔽and so on,🔽and in the same vein as before,

original: ji ltar sngar dpes bstan pa de kho na bzhin du sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar sngar dpes bstan pa de kho na bzhin du sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: should be applied just as they were previously explained in the parables.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o // de nas bcom ldan 'das la /
translated: Subhuti, it is in this way that a Bodhisattva, a great being, is said to be wearing the great armor.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhuti said to the Lord:

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don @17b bdag gis 'tshal ba ltar na /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don @17b bdag gis 'tshal ba ltar na /
translated: “Lord, according to my understanding of the meaning of the words spoken by the Lord,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi slad du /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi slad du /
translated: it is because of the emptiness of its own mark

original: kye ma byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni go cha ma mchis pa'i go cha 'tshal bar rig par bgyi lags so //
analyzed: kye ma byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni go cha ma mchis pa'i go cha 'tshal bar rig par bgyi lags so //
translated: that one should know that a Bodhisattva, a great being, is wearing the armor for the non-wearing of armor.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong /
translated: Because form is empty of form,

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong /
translated: and likewise feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty of consciousness.

original: de bzhin du mig ni mig gis stong /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig ni mig gis stong /
translated: Likewise, the eyes are empty of the eyes,

original: yid kyi bar ni yid kyis stong /
analyzed: yid kyi bar ni yid kyis stong /
translated: and so on up to: the mind is empty of the mind.

original: de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pas stong /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pas stong /
translated: Similarly, eye consciousness is empty of eye consciousness,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas stong /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas stong /
translated: and up to mind consciousness is empty of mind consciousness.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa ni mig gi 'dus te reg pas stong /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa ni mig gi 'dus te reg pas stong /
translated: Eye contact is empty of eye contact,

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar ni yid kyi 'dus te reg pas stong /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar ni yid kyi 'dus te reg pas stong /
translated: and up to mind contact is empty of mind contact.

original: de bzhin du mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni /
translated: Similarly, feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bas stong /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bas stong /
translated: is empty of feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact,

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i bar ni /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i bar ni /
translated: and up to feeling that arises from the condition of mind contact

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bas stong /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bas stong /
translated: is empty of feeling that arises from the condition of mind contact.

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Venerable Transcendent Victor,

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: similarly, the perfection of generosity

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas stong /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas stong /
translated: is empty of the perfection of generosity,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar ni /
translated: and up to the perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas stong /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas stong /
translated: is empty of the perfection of wisdom.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams ni /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams ni /
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness are as follows.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyis stong /🔽'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar ni /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyis stong / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar ni /
translated: the applications of mindfulness are empty of the applications of mindfulness,🔽the right efforts are empty of the right efforts,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan @18a *//🔽lag brgyad pas stong /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan @18a *// lag brgyad pas stong /
translated: the legs of supernormal power are empty of the legs of supernormal power,🔽the faculties are empty of the faculties,

original: nang stong pa nyid ni nang stong pa nyid kyis stong /🔽dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid ni nang stong pa nyid kyis stong / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni /
translated: the powers are empty of the powers,🔽the limbs of awakening are empty of the limbs of awakening,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis stong /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyis stong /
translated: the path is empty of the path,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcus stong /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcus stong /
translated: the ten powers of the tathāgatas are empty of the ten powers of the tathāgatas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyis stong /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyis stong /
translated: and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas are empty of the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Venerable Transcendent Victor,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang byang chub sems dpas stong /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang byang chub sems dpas stong /
translated: the bodhisattvas are empty of the bodhisattvas,

original: go cha chen po'ang go cha chen pos stong pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: go cha chen po'ang go cha chen pos stong pa'i slad du ste /
translated: and the great armor is empty of the great armor.

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Venerable Transcendent Victor,

original: rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na /
translated: For this reason,

original: kye ma byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni go cha ma mchis pa'i go cha 'tshal bar rig par bgyi lags so //🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: kye ma byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni go cha ma mchis pa'i go cha 'tshal bar rig par bgyi lags so // de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: it should be known that the bodhisattva great being is the one who dons the armor of non-armor.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord then said to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Su­bhūti!

original: ji skad smras pa bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa bzhin te /
translated: It is exactly as you have said!

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni ma byas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang dag gi ched du go cha chen po bgos pa'i sems can de dag kyang ma byas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni ma byas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang dag gi ched du go cha chen po bgos pa'i sems can de dag kyang ma byas /
translated: Su­bhūti, the knowledge of all aspects is not created and is not formed.

original: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa dag yin no //🔽de skad ces bka' stsal pa @18b dang / bcom ldan 'das la /🔽tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa dag yin no // de skad ces bka' stsal pa @18b dang / bcom ldan 'das la / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Those sentient beings for the sake of whom the bodhisattva great beings don the great armor are also not created and are not formed.🔽” The Lord having said this,🔽the venerable Su­bhūti then said to him,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Reverend Lord!

original: ci'i slad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma bgyis shing mngon par 'dus ma bgyis la /
analyzed: ci'i slad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma bgyis shing mngon par 'dus ma bgyis la /
translated: Why is the knowledge of all aspects not made or not brought about?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang dag gi ched du go cha chen po 'tshal ba'i sems can de dag kyang ma bgyis shing mngon par 'dus ma bgyis pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang dag gi ched du go cha chen po 'tshal ba'i sems can de dag kyang ma bgyis shing mngon par 'dus ma bgyis pa lags /
translated: And why are those sentient beings for whose sake the bodhisattva great beings don the great armor not made or not brought about?”🔽The Lord said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / byed pa po dmigs su med pa'i phyir /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de ma byas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / byed pa po dmigs su med pa'i phyir / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de ma byas /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of all aspects is not made or brought about because a maker is not apprehended.

original: sems can de dag kyang ma byas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang ma byas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: Those sentient beings are also not made or brought about.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?🔽Subhūti, form does not make, does not destroy, and does not bring about;

original: rab 'byor / gzugs ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do; ;de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do; ;de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed de /
translated: and similarly, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness do not make, do not destroy, and do not bring about.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du bdag ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du bdag ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, the self does not make, does not destroy, does not manifest.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du shes pa po dang / mthong ba po'i bar du ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du shes pa po dang / mthong ba po'i bar du ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, up to the knower and the seer do not make, do not destroy, do not manifest.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / bdag la sogs pa gtan dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / bdag la sogs pa gtan dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because the self and so on are absolutely non-apprehensible.

original: rab 'byor / rmi lam yang mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rmi lam yang mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: Subhūti, a dream does not make, does not destroy, does not manifest.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rab 'byor / rmi lam ni gtan @19a *//
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor / rmi lam ni gtan @19a *//
translated: Why is that?

original: dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
translated: Subhūti, it is because a dream is absolutely non-apprehensible.

original: de bzhin du brag ca dang / mi g-yor dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / sprul pa ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du brag ca dang / mi g-yor dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / sprul pa ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: In the same way, an echo, an optical aberration, an illusion, a mirage, and a magical creation do not make, do not destroy, do not manifest.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar sprul pa de gtan dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar sprul pa de gtan dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because a magical creation is absolutely non-apprehensible.

original: rab 'byor / nang stong pa nyid ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / nang stong pa nyid ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: Subhūti, the emptiness of internal phenomena does not make anything, does not break anything, and does not occasion anything.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar nang stong pa nyid de gtan dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar nang stong pa nyid de gtan dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because the emptiness of internal phenomena is not apprehended at all.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way, connect this with each, up to🔽Subhūti, the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities does not make anything, does not break anything, and does not occasion anything.

original: rab 'byor / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar de gtan dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar de gtan dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities is not apprehended at all.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: In the same way, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha do not make anything, do not break anything, and do not occasion anything.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du gtan dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du gtan dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not apprehended at all.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin nyid ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin nyid ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: Subhūti, suchness does not make, does not unmake, and does not manifest.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang; chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang; chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, the unerring thusness, the unaltered thusness, the true nature of dharmas, the dharma-constituent, the establishment of dharmas, the certification of dharmas, and the very limit of reality do not make, do not unmake, and do not manifest.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: 'di @19b ltar yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar de gtan dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di @19b ltar yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar de gtan dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because up to the very limit of reality is absolutely non-apprehensible.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva does not make, does not unmake, and does not manifest.

original: de bzhin du thams cad shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni mi byed mi 'jig mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: In the same way, the knowledge of path aspects and the knowledge of all aspects do not make, do not unmake, and do not manifest.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar de gtan dmigs su med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar de gtan dmigs su med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because up to and including the knowledge of all aspects, they are absolutely unapprehendable.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni ma byas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni ma byas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa yin /
translated: Subhūti, for this reason the knowledge of all aspects is not made, not brought about.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang dag gi ched du go cha chen po bgos pa'i sems can de dag kyang ma byas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang dag gi ched du go cha chen po bgos pa'i sems can de dag kyang ma byas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa yin te /
translated: Those beings for whose sake the bodhisattva great beings don out the great armor are also not made, not brought about.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang /
translated: Subhūti, for this reason

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos go cha chen po bgos par rig par bya'o ////
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos go cha chen po bgos par rig par bya'o ////
translated: you should know that the bodhisattva great beings have donned the great armor.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri ba /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri ba /
translated: Noble Mahāyāna Sūtra of the Perfection of Wisdom

original: bam po bcu pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu pa /
translated: Fascicle 10

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One:

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Venerable Blessed One,

original: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don 'chal ba ltar na /
analyzed: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don 'chal ba ltar na /
translated: according to the meaning I understand of what the Blessed One has said,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Venerable Transcendent Victor,

original: gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba lags so //
analyzed: gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba lags so //
translated: form is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba lags so //🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i @20a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba lags so // de nas tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i @20a *//
translated: Similarly, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are neither bound nor liberated.

original: bu gang pos /
analyzed: bu gang pos /
translated: Then the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said this to the venerable Su­bhūti:

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Su­bhūti!

original: gzugs ma bcings ma grol ba yin nam /
analyzed: gzugs ma bcings ma grol ba yin nam /
translated: Is form neither bound nor liberated?

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma bcings ma grol ba yin nam /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma bcings ma grol ba yin nam /
translated: Are feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness also neither bound nor liberated?”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: He replied, “Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de bzhin te /
analyzed: de bzhin te /
translated: it is just so!

original: gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Form is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Similarly, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are neither bound nor liberated.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa gang pos /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa gang pos /
translated: Then the venerable Pūrṇa

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: He said this to the venerable Subhūti:

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: gzugs ma bcings ma grol ba gang yin /
analyzed: gzugs ma bcings ma grol ba gang yin /
translated: what is the form that is neither bound nor liberated?

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma bcings ma grol ba gang yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma bcings ma grol ba gang yin /
translated: Similarly, what is the feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness that is neither bound nor liberated?”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: He replied, “Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: rmi lam lta bu'i gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: rmi lam lta bu'i gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: form that is like a dream is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du rmi lam lta bu'i tshor ba dang / rmi lam lta bu'i 'du shes dang / rmi lam lta bu'i 'du byed rnams dang / rmi lam lta bu'i rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rmi lam lta bu'i tshor ba dang / rmi lam lta bu'i 'du shes dang / rmi lam lta bu'i 'du byed rnams dang / rmi lam lta bu'i rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Similarly, feeling that is like a dream, perception that is like a dream, volitional factors that are like a dream, and consciousness that is like a dream is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way,

original: brag ca lta bu'i gzugs dang / rnam par shes pa'i bar ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: brag ca lta bu'i gzugs dang / rnam par shes pa'i bar ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: form that is like an echo and consciousness are neither bound nor liberated.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de bzhin du mig yor lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sprul pa lta @20b bu'i gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig yor lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu dang / smig rgyu lta bu dang / sprul pa lta @20b bu'i gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Likewise, forms that are like a reflected image, like an illusion, like a mirage, and like a magical creation are neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du sprul pa lta bu'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sprul pa lta bu'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Likewise, feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness that are like a magical creation are neither bound nor liberated.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: 'das pa'i gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: past form is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du 'das pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'das pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Likewise, past feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness are neither bound nor liberated.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: future form is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Likewise, future feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness are neither bound nor liberated.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de bzhin du da ltar byung ba'i gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du da ltar byung ba'i gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Likewise, present form is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du da ltar byung ba'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du da ltar byung ba'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Likewise, present feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness are neither bound nor liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: med pa'i phyir gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Because of non-existence, form is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Likewise, because of the non-existence of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness,

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: all consciousness is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dben pa'i phyir; gzugs thams cad ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dben pa'i phyir; gzugs thams cad ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Likewise, because of the seclusion of form, all form is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dben pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa dben pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dben pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa dben pa'i phyir /
translated: Likewise, because of the seclusion of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness,

original: rnam @21a *// par shes pa thams cad ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: rnam @21a *// par shes pa thams cad ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: all consciousness is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du gzugs skye ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs skye ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, because form is unborn,

original: gzugs thams cad ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o;/
analyzed: gzugs thams cad ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o;/
translated: all forms are neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa skye ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa skye ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, because feelings, perceptions, formations, and consciousness are unborn,

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: all consciousnesses are neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du gzugs 'gag pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs 'gag pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, because form is unceasing,

original: gzugs thams cad ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs thams cad ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: all forms are neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams 'gag pa med pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa 'gag pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams 'gag pa med pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa 'gag pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, because feelings, perceptions, formations, and consciousness are unceasing,

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: all consciousnesses are neither bound nor liberated.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de bzhin du gzugs dge ba ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dge ba ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: similarly, virtuous form is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dge ba dang / 'du shes dge ba dang / 'du byed dge ba rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dge ba ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dge ba dang / 'du shes dge ba dang / 'du byed dge ba rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dge ba ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Likewise, virtuous feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du gzugs mi dge ba ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs mi dge ba ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Likewise, nonvirtuous form is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed mi dge ba rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi dge ba ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed mi dge ba rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi dge ba ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Likewise, nonvirtuous feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du gzugs lung du ma bstan pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs lung du ma bstan pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Likewise, neutral form is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang / rnam par shes pa lung du @21b ma bstan pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed lung du ma bstan pa rnams dang / rnam par shes pa lung du @21b ma bstan pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o // de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Likewise, neutral feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are neither bound nor liberated.

original: 'jig rten pa'i gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: In the same way, worldly form is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / 'jig rten pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / 'jig rten pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Likewise, worldly feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness are neither bound nor liberated.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Supramundane form is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Likewise, supramundane feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness are neither bound nor liberated.

original: gzugs zag pa dang bcas pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs zag pa dang bcas pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Form that is subject to cankers is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed zag pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zag pa dang bcas pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed zag pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zag pa dang bcas pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Likewise, feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness that are subject to cankers are neither bound nor liberated.

original: gzugs zag pa med pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs zag pa med pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Form that is not subject to cankers is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed zag pa med pa rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zag pa med pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed zag pa med pa rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zag pa med pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Likewise, the uncontaminated feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not bound and are not liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs med pa'i phyir dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams med pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir gzugs ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i phyir dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams med pa'i phyir dang / rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir gzugs ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Because form does not exist, and feeling, perception, the volitional factors, and consciousness do not exist, form is not bound and is not liberated.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Likewise, feeling, perception, the volitional factors, and consciousness are not bound and are not liberated.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang @22a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang @22a *//
translated: Likewise, form is not bound and is not liberated.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar du dben pa'i phyir dang / gzugs dang rnam par shes pa'i bar du skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / gzugs dang rnam par shes pa'i bar du 'gag pa med pa'i phyir dang / gzugs dang rnam par shes pa'i bar du ma bcings ma grol ba'i phyir gzugs dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar du dben pa'i phyir dang / gzugs dang rnam par shes pa'i bar du skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / gzugs dang rnam par shes pa'i bar du 'gag pa med pa'i phyir dang / gzugs dang rnam par shes pa'i bar du ma bcings ma grol ba'i phyir gzugs dang /
translated: Because form is empty of form, up to because consciousness is empty of consciousness, up to because form is unborn, up to because consciousness is unborn, up to because form is unceasing, up to because consciousness is unceasing, up to because form is unfettered and not liberated, up to because consciousness is unfettered and not liberated.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar du ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar du ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, in the same way, up to consciousness is unfettered and not liberated.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: chos thams cad kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: all phenomena are unfettered and not liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad med pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad med pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Because all phenomena are nonexistent, all phenomena are unfettered and not liberated.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad dben pa'i phyir dang / skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / 'gag pa med pa'i phyir dang / ma bcings pa'i phyir dang / ma grol pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad dben pa'i phyir dang / skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / 'gag pa med pa'i phyir dang / ma bcings pa'i phyir dang / ma grol pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: In the same way, because all phenomena are void, because they are unborn, because they are unceasing, because they are unfettered, and because they are not liberated, all phenomena are unfettered and not liberated.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: the perfection of generosity is neither fettered nor liberated.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: similarly, the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patient acceptance, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of meditative concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are neither fettered nor liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the perfection of generosity does not exist,

original: ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: it is neither fettered nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @22b pa'i bar du med pa nyid kyi phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @22b pa'i bar du med pa nyid kyi phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Similarly, up to the perfection of wisdom does not exist, it is neither fettered nor liberated.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: nang stong pa nyid kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: inner emptiness is neither fettered nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du'ang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du'ang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: In the same way, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: In the same way, the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path,

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: the three gateways to liberation, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, and in the same vein,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: up to the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas are neither bound nor liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dben pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ma bcings pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ma grol ba nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dben pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ma bcings pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ma grol ba nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Because they do not exist, are void, are not fettered, and are not liberated, up to and including the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: byang chub kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: awakening, too, is not fettered and is not liberated.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de bzhin du thams cad shes pa nyid dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' yang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad shes pa nyid dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' yang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: in the same way, the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of path aspects, the knowledge of all aspects, and a bodhisattva are not fettered and are not liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dben pa nyid kyi phyir dang / skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / 'gag pa med pa nyid kyi phyir de @23a *//
analyzed: med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dben pa nyid kyi phyir dang / skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / 'gag pa med pa nyid kyi phyir de @23a *//
translated: Because they do not exist, are void, are not produced, and do not stop,

original: bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and so on up to

original: sangs rgyas kyi bar du'ang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bar du'ang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: a buddha is not fettered and is not liberated.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de bzhin nyid kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: suchness is also neither bound nor liberated.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de bzhin du ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang; yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / 'dus ma byas kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang; yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / 'dus ma byas kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: in the same way, the unmistaken real nature, the unaltered real nature, the dharma-constituent, the establishment of dharmas, the certification of dharmas, the very limit of reality, and the inconceivable element are also neither bound nor liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?
