original: 'dus ma byas kyi bar du med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dben pa nyid kyi phyir dang / skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / 'gag pa med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ma bcings pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ma grol ba nyid kyi phyir 'dus ma byas kyi bar du ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi bar du med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dben pa nyid kyi phyir dang / skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / 'gag pa med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ma bcings pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ma grol ba nyid kyi phyir 'dus ma byas kyi bar du ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Up to the unconditioned element is neither bound nor liberated because of nonexistence, because of being void, because of nonproduction, because of nonstopping, because of not being bound, and because of not being liberated.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ma bcings ma grol ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ma bcings ma grol ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: That is the bodhisattva great beings’ perfection of giving, which is neither bound nor freed, up to the perfection of wisdom, up to the knowledge of all aspects, which is neither bound nor freed.

original: le'u gong mar ji skad bstan pa de kho na bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: le'u gong mar ji skad bstan pa de kho na bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It should be connected in the same way as in the previous chapter.

original: de ma bcings ma grol ba'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: de ma bcings ma grol ba'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: Standing in the perfection of giving, which is neither bound nor freed,

original: ma bcings ma grol ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la gnas /
analyzed: ma bcings ma grol ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la gnas /
translated: standing in the perfection of wisdom, which is neither bound nor freed,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and similarly, connect this with each,

original: ma bcings ma grol ba'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid @23b kyi bar la gnas te /
analyzed: ma bcings ma grol ba'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid @23b kyi bar la gnas te /
translated: standing in the knowledge of all aspects, which is neither bound nor freed,

original: ma bcings ma grol ba'i sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: ma bcings ma grol ba'i sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: they bring about the full liberation of beings, which is neither bound nor freed.

original: ma bcings ma grol ba kho na'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
analyzed: ma bcings ma grol ba kho na'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed do //
translated: They purify a buddhafield, which is neither bound nor freed.

original: de ma bcings ma grol ba kho na'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed do //
analyzed: de ma bcings ma grol ba kho na'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsnyen bkur byed do //
translated: They serve the blessed buddhas, who are not bound and not liberated.

original: de sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las ma bcings ma grol ba kho na'i chos kyang nyan to //
analyzed: de sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las ma bcings ma grol ba kho na'i chos kyang nyan to //
translated: They listen to the Dharma of those blessed buddhas, who are not bound and not liberated.

original: ma bcings ma grol ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma bcings ma grol ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They are never separated from those blessed buddhas, who are not bound and not liberated.

original: ma bcings ma grol ba'i mngon par shes pa rnams dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma bcings ma grol ba'i mngon par shes pa rnams dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They are never separated from the superknowledges, which are not bound and not liberated.

original: ma bcings ma grol ba'i mig lnga dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma bcings ma grol ba'i mig lnga dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They are never separated from the five eyes, which are not bound and not liberated.

original: ma bcings ma grol ba'i gzungs rnams dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma bcings ma grol ba'i gzungs rnams dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They are never separated from the dhāraṇīs, which are not bound and not liberated.

original: ma bcings ma grol ba'i ting nge 'dzin rnams dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma bcings ma grol ba'i ting nge 'dzin rnams dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They are never separated from the meditative stabilities, which are not bound and not liberated.

original: ma bcings ma grol ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang mngon par sgrub bo //
analyzed: ma bcings ma grol ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang mngon par sgrub bo //
translated: They accomplish omniscience, which is not bound and not liberated.

original: ma bcings ma grol ba'i lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyang skyed par byed do //
analyzed: ma bcings ma grol ba'i lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyang skyed par byed do //
translated: He also generates the knowledge of the aspects of the path that is neither bound nor liberated.

original: ma bcings ma grol ba'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: ma bcings ma grol ba'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: He also fully awakens to the knowledge of all aspects that is neither bound nor liberated.

original: ma bcings ma grol ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo'ang bskor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma bcings ma grol ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo'ang bskor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He also turns the wheel of the Dharma that is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de ma bcings ma grol ba'i sems can rnams theg pa gsum po dag la sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: de ma bcings ma grol ba'i sems can rnams theg pa gsum po dag la sbyor bar byed de /
translated: He also connects beings who are neither bound nor liberated to the three vehicles.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /🔽de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ma bcings ma grol @24a *//
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ma bcings ma grol @24a *//
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gis ma bcings ma grol ba'i chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
analyzed: pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gis ma bcings ma grol ba'i chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
translated: in this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, through the six perfections that are neither bound nor liberated, fully awakens to all dharmas that are neither bound nor liberated.

original: chos thams cad med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / zhi ba nyid kyi phyir dang / dben pa nyid kyi phyir dang / skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / 'gag pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / zhi ba nyid kyi phyir dang / dben pa nyid kyi phyir dang / skye ba med pa nyid kyi phyir dang / 'gag pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are non-existent, because they are peace, because they are void, because they are non-arisen, and because they are unceasing.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de lta bu ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ma bcings ma grol ba'i go cha chen po yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i ma bcings ma grol ba'i go cha chen po yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: one should know that such is the great armor of the bodhisattva mahāsattva, which is neither bound nor liberated.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i go cha chen po ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i go cha chen po ni /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the great armor of the bodhisattva mahāsattva

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: is as follows:

original: mngon par shes pa drug po dag yongs su dag par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug po dag yongs su dag par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is the purification of the six higher knowledges.

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i mig mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i mig mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang /
translated: the superknowledge that is the knowledge of the divine eye, the superknowledge that is the knowledge of the divine ear,

original: pha rol gyi sems kyi rnam pa shes pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems kyi rnam pa shes pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid de /
translated: the superknowledge that is the knowledge of the aspects of the minds of others, the superknowledge that is the knowledge of the recollection of former existences, and the superknowledge that is the knowledge of the extinction of defilements.

original: rab 'byor / de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mngon par shes pa drug po @24b dag yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mngon par shes pa drug po @24b dag yin no //
translated: Subhūti, these are the six superknowledges of bodhisattva great beings.

original: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of the clairvoyance that is the knowledge of the performance of miracles?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas nas /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of wisdom

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba rnam pa du ma myong bar byed de /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba rnam pa du ma myong bar byed de /
translated: experience many kinds of performance of miracles.

original: des 'di'ang g-yo bar byed do //🔽de bzhin du gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur ba dang / mang por gyur nas kyang gcig tu 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du snang bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: des 'di'ang g-yo bar byed do // de bzhin du gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur ba dang / mang por gyur nas kyang gcig tu 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du snang bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: They shake this one,

original: mi snang bar 'gyur ba'ang myong bar byed do //🔽rtsig pa la'ang thad kar 'gro'o //🔽rab la'ang thad kar 'gro'o //
analyzed: mi snang bar 'gyur ba'ang myong bar byed do // rtsig pa la'ang thad kar 'gro'o // rab la'ang thad kar 'gro'o //
translated: and likewise they experience becoming many from being one and becoming one from being many, and likewise becoming visible and becoming invisible.🔽They go right through a wall.🔽They go right through a rampart.

original: ri la'ang mi thogs par thad kar 'gro ste /
analyzed: ri la'ang mi thogs par thad kar 'gro ste /
translated: They go right through a mountain as if through space.

original: dper na / nam mkha' la bya ba bzhin no; ;nam mkha' la'ang skyil mo krung bcas nas 'gro ste /
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha' la bya ba bzhin no; ;nam mkha' la'ang skyil mo krung bcas nas 'gro ste /
translated: One can also walk in the sky, sitting cross-legged.

original: dper na / 'dab chags bya bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / 'dab chags bya bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a bird.

original: sa la'ang steng du 'byung ba dang / byi'u zul byed de /
analyzed: sa la'ang steng du 'byung ba dang / byi'u zul byed de /
translated: One can also dive into the earth and emerge from it,🔽as if in water.

original: dper na / chu la bya ba bzhin no; ;chu la'ang mi nub par 'gro ste /
analyzed: dper na / chu la bya ba bzhin no; ;chu la'ang mi nub par 'gro ste /
translated: One can also walk on water without sinking,

original: dper na / sa la bya ba bzhin no //🔽du ba 'thul bar yang byed /
analyzed: dper na / sa la bya ba bzhin no // du ba 'thul bar yang byed /
translated: as if on earth.

original: 'bar bar yang byed de /
analyzed: 'bar bar yang byed de /
translated: One can also emit smoke and flames,

original: dper na / me'i phung po chen po bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / me'i phung po chen po bzhin no //
translated: as if in a great bonfire.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba 'di gnyis 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che ba /🔽'di ltar mthu che ba /
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba 'di gnyis 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che ba / 'di ltar mthu che ba /
translated: One can also touch and stroke the moon and sun,🔽which are so powerful and majestic,

original: 'di ltar dbang che bar grags pa 'di dag la'ang lag pas nyug par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang che bar grags pa 'di dag la'ang lag pas nyug par byed do //
translated: with one’s hand.

original: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du'ang lus kyis dbang @25a *//
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du'ang lus kyis dbang @25a *//
translated: One can also travel with the body as far as the Brahmā world.

original: sgyur ro // gang gis rlom sems su byed pa dang / gang la rlom sems su byed pa dang / gang zhig rlom sems su byed pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir rdzu 'phrul des kyang rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: sgyur ro // gang gis rlom sems su byed pa dang / gang la rlom sems su byed pa dang / gang zhig rlom sems su byed pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir rdzu 'phrul des kyang rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: Because of the emptiness of inherent existence, the isolation of inherent existence, and the non-apprehension of inherent existence, they do not become proud because of that miraculous ability.

original: rdzu 'phrul de la'ang rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul de la'ang rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not become proud about that miraculous ability.

original: dmigs par yang mi byed cing /
analyzed: dmigs par yang mi byed cing /
translated: They do not make it into an objective support.

original: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa ma gtogs par rdzu 'phrul mngon par sgrub pa'i sems pa'ang mi bskyed do //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa ma gtogs par rdzu 'phrul mngon par sgrub pa'i sems pa'ang mi bskyed do //
translated: Except for paying attention to the knowledge of all aspects, they do not even arouse the thought of accomplishing miraculous abilities.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom purifies the clairvoyance that is the knowledge that realizes magical abilities.

original: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lha'i mig mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lha'i mig mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what is the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s purification of the clairvoyance that is the knowledge that realizes the divine eye?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: Subhūti, here the bodhisattva mahāsattva who is in the perfection of wisdom

original: lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las 'das pas sems can 'chi 'pho ba rnams dang / skye ba rnams dang / kha dog bzang po rnams dang / kha dog ngan pa rnams dang / bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro dang / ngan pa dang /
analyzed: lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las 'das pas sems can 'chi 'pho ba rnams dang / skye ba rnams dang / kha dog bzang po rnams dang / kha dog ngan pa rnams dang / bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro dang / ngan pa dang /
translated: with a divine eye that is pure and surpasses that of humans sees sentient beings dying and being born, sees them with good color and bad color, sees them going to good migrations and to bad migrations, sees them with good fortune and with bad fortune, in accordance with their actions.

original: bar ma dang / gya nom pa'i @25b sems can rnams las ji ltar bsags pa bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: bar ma dang / gya nom pa'i @25b sems can rnams las ji ltar bsags pa bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: He knows the middling and the sublime sentient beings just as they are.

original: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: “Alas! These sentient beings have physical misconduct,

original: ngag gi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: ngag gi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: verbal misconduct,

original: yid kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yid kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: and mental misconduct.

original: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa 'debs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa 'debs pa /
translated: They slander the noble ones,

original: log par lta ba dang ldan pa dag ste /
analyzed: log par lta ba dang ldan pa dag ste /
translated: and they have wrong views.

original: kye ma de dag ni log par lta ba yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen des lus zhig ste shi nas /
analyzed: kye ma de dag ni log par lta ba yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen des lus zhig ste shi nas /
translated: Alas! Due to the cause and condition of taking up wrong views, when their bodies disintegrate and they die,

original: ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi nang du skyes so //
analyzed: ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi nang du skyes so //
translated: they will be born in the lower realms, the bad destinies, among the hell beings.🔽“Alas! These sentient beings have physical good conduct,

original: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa; ngag gi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa; ngag gi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: verbal good conduct,

original: yid kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa dag yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa dag yin te /
translated: and mental good conduct.

original: rgyu de dang rkyen des lus zhig nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skyes pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: rgyu de dang rkyen des lus zhig nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skyes pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: By that cause and that condition, after the body breaks up, they are born in a good place, in a heavenly realm, among the gods and humans.

original: phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag na sems can las ji ltar bsags pa rnams mthong ba'i bar dang / bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skyes so zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag na sems can las ji ltar bsags pa rnams mthong ba'i bar dang / bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skyes so zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: In the same way, they see the karma that sentient beings have accumulated in all the world systems in the ten directions, and that after the body breaks up they are born in a good place, in a heavenly realm, among the gods and humans.

original: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lha'i mig mngon sum du bya /🔽ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid yin no //🔽rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lha'i rna ba mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon @26a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lha'i mig mngon sum du bya / ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid yin no // rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lha'i rna ba mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon @26a *//
translated: Subhūti, that is the bodhisattva great beings’ divine eye clairvoyance that is purified.

original: par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what is the bodhisattva great beings’ divine ear clairvoyance that is purified?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of wisdom

original: lha'i rna ba mi'i las 'das pas de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lha'i rna ba mi'i las 'das pas de 'di lta ste /
translated: with the divine ear that surpasses the human ear

original: lha dang mi'i sgra nyan kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir bdag ni sgra nyan to zhes lha'i rna ba des kyang rlom sems su mi byed cing /
analyzed: lha dang mi'i sgra nyan kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir bdag ni sgra nyan to zhes lha'i rna ba des kyang rlom sems su mi byed cing /
translated: listen to this sort of sound, the sound of gods and humans, but because of the emptiness of an intrinsic nature, the absence of an intrinsic nature, and the nonapprehension of an intrinsic nature, they do not think, ‘I am listening to a sound with the divine ear.’

original: rna bas shes par bya ba'i sgra de'ang mi dmigs la /
analyzed: rna bas shes par bya ba'i sgra de'ang mi dmigs la /
translated: They do not apprehend that sound that is to be known by the ear.

original: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa ma gtogs par lha'i rna ba mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir sems kyang skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa ma gtogs par lha'i rna ba mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir sems kyang skyed par mi byed de /
translated: Except for paying attention to the knowledge of all aspects, they do not even arouse a thought to accomplish the divine ear.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: Subhūti, in that way bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of wisdom

original: lha'i rna ba mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is the purification of the superknowledge that is the direct experience of the divine ear.

original: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i pha rol gyi sems kyi rnam pa shes pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i pha rol gyi sems kyi rnam pa shes pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of the superknowledge that is the direct experience of the knowledge of others’ minds?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of wisdom🔽know with their minds the minds of other beings and other persons just as they are.

original: de sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan @26b rnams kyi sems sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan @26b rnams kyi sems sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te / 'di lta ste /
translated: They know🔽a mind with passion as a mind with passion,

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: and a mind without passion as a mind without passion.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is a mind free from passion as a mind free from passion.

original: zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems la zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems la zhe sdang dang bcas pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is a mind with aversion as a mind with aversion.

original: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems la zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems la zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is a mind free from aversion as a mind free from aversion.

original: gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems la gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems la gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is a mind with confusion as a mind with confusion.

original: gti mug dang bral ba'i sems la gti mug dang bral ba'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gti mug dang bral ba'i sems la gti mug dang bral ba'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is a mind free from confusion as a mind free from confusion.

original: de bzhin du sred pa dang bcas pa'i sems la sred pa dang bcas pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sred pa dang bcas pa'i sems la sred pa dang bcas pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: Similarly, he knows as it really is a mind with craving as a mind with craving.

original: sred pa dang bral ba'i sems la sred pa dang bral ba'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sred pa dang bral ba'i sems la sred pa dang bral ba'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows a mind free from craving as it really is as a mind free from craving.🔽Similarly, he knows a mind with grasping as it really is as a mind with grasping, and a mind without grasping as it really is as a mind without grasping. He knows a contracted mind as it really is as a contracted mind, and a distracted mind as it really is as a distracted mind. He knows a small mind as it really is as a small mind, and a great mind as it really is as a great mind. He knows a concentrated mind as it really is as a concentrated mind, and an unconcentrated mind as it really is as an unconcentrated mind. He knows a liberated mind as it really is as a liberated mind, and an unliberated mind as it really is as an unliberated mind. He knows a surpassable mind as it really is as a surpassable mind,

original: de bzhin du nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang / nye bar len pa med pa'i sems dang / sems bsdus pa dang / sems rnam par g-yengs pa dang / sems chung ngu dang / sems rgya chen por gyur pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i @27a *//🔽sems dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems dang / sems rnam par grol ba dang / sems rnam par ma grol ba dang / bla na yod pa'i sems la bla na yod pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //🔽bla na med pa'i sems la /
analyzed: de bzhin du nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang / nye bar len pa med pa'i sems dang / sems bsdus pa dang / sems rnam par g-yengs pa dang / sems chung ngu dang / sems rgya chen por gyur pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i @27a *// sems dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems dang / sems rnam par grol ba dang / sems rnam par ma grol ba dang / bla na yod pa'i sems la bla na yod pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so // bla na med pa'i sems la /
translated: and an unsurpassable mind as it really is as an unsurpassable mind.

original: bla na med pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la /
translated: He knows a mind with outflows as it really is as a mind with outflows, and a mind without outflows as it really is as a mind without outflows. He knows a mind with afflictions as it really is as a mind with afflictions, and a mind without afflictions as it really is as a mind without afflictions. He knows a mind that is still subject to rebirth as it really is as a mind that is still subject to rebirth, and a mind that is no longer subject to rebirth as it really is as a mind that is no longer subject to rebirth. He knows a mind that can be improved as it really is as a mind that can be improved, and a mind that cannot be improved as it really is as a mind that cannot be improved. He knows a mind that can be surpassed as it really is as a mind that can be surpassed, and a mind that cannot be surpassed as it really is as a mind that cannot be surpassed. He knows a mind that is still in training as it really is as a mind that is still in training, and a mind that is no longer in training as it really is as a mind that is no longer in training. He knows a śrāvaka mind as it really is as a śrāvaka mind, and a pratyekabuddha mind as it really is as a pratyekabuddha mind. He knows a buddha mind as it really is as a buddha mind.

original: de dag gis rlom sems su'ang mi byed do //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gis rlom sems su'ang mi byed do //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: He does not become proud on account of them

original: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir sems de dag ni sems ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir sems de dag ni sems ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those minds are not minds, because of the emptiness of essential nature.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And so on.

original: ji ltar gong du bstan pa de kho na bzhin du rgya cher sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gong du bstan pa de kho na bzhin du rgya cher sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: This should be extensively applied in the same way as previously explained.

original: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i pha rol gyi sems kyi rnam pa shes pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i pha rol gyi sems kyi rnam pa shes pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: Subhūti, that is the bodhisattva great being’s purification of the higher cognition of the knowledge that directly perceives the minds of others.

original: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, what is the bodhisattva great being’s purification of the higher cognition of the knowledge that directly perceives the recollection of past lives?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of wisdom

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub cing /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub cing /
translated: They accomplish the supernormal knowledge that perceives the recollection of past lives.

original: des sems gcig rjes su dran pa nas /
analyzed: des sems gcig rjes su dran pa nas /
translated: They recollect one mind,

original: sems brgya'i @27b par dang / sems stong gi bar du'ang rjes su dran no //
analyzed: sems brgya'i @27b par dang / sems stong gi bar du'ang rjes su dran no //
translated: up to a hundred minds, a thousand minds, and so on.

original: nyi ma gcig kyang rjes su dran pa nas nyi ma brgya'i bar dang / nyi ma stong gi bar dang / nyi ma 'bum gyi bar du'ang rjes su dran no //🔽zla ba gcig kyang rjes su dran pa nas /
analyzed: nyi ma gcig kyang rjes su dran pa nas nyi ma brgya'i bar dang / nyi ma stong gi bar dang / nyi ma 'bum gyi bar du'ang rjes su dran no // zla ba gcig kyang rjes su dran pa nas /
translated: They recollect one day, up to a hundred days, a thousand days, and so on.

original: zla ba brgya'i bar dang / zla ba stong gi bar dang / zla ba 'bum gyi bar du'ang rjes su dran no;/🔽lo gcig kyang rjes su dran pa nas /
analyzed: zla ba brgya'i bar dang / zla ba stong gi bar dang / zla ba 'bum gyi bar du'ang rjes su dran no;/ lo gcig kyang rjes su dran pa nas /
translated: They recollect one month, up to a hundred months, a thousand months, and so on.

original: lo 'bum gyi bar du'ang rjes su dran no //🔽bskal pa gcig kyang rjes su dran pa nas /
analyzed: lo 'bum gyi bar du'ang rjes su dran no //🔽bskal pa gcig kyang rjes su dran pa nas /
translated: They recollect one year, up to a hundred years, a thousand years, and so on.🔽They recollect one eon, up to a hundred eons, a thousand eons, and so on.

original: bskal pa brgya phrag du ma'i bar dang / bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa 'bum phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dag kyang rjes su dran no //🔽de na bdag gi ming ni 'di zhes bya bar gyur /🔽rus ni 'di zhes bya /🔽rigs ni 'di zhes bya /🔽zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /🔽yun ni 'di srid cig gnas gnas /🔽tshe ni 'di tsam zhig thub /🔽tshe ring khyad ni 'di tsam zhig lon /
analyzed: bskal pa brgya phrag du ma'i bar dang / bskal pa stong phrag du ma dang / bskal pa 'bum phrag du ma dang / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dag kyang rjes su dran no // de na bdag gi ming ni 'di zhes bya bar gyur / rus ni 'di zhes bya / rigs ni 'di zhes bya / zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za / yun ni 'di srid cig gnas gnas / tshe ni 'di tsam zhig thub / tshe ring khyad ni 'di tsam zhig lon /
translated: He recollects many hundreds of eons, many thousands of eons, many hundreds of thousands of eons, many hundreds of millions of eons, many hundreds of billions of eons, many hundreds of trillions of eons.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong /
translated: He recollects: ‘There I had such and such a name, such and such a caste, ate such and such food, experienced such and such happiness and suffering, lived for such and such a length of time, and experienced such and such an end.

original: de de nas shi 'phos nas che ge mo zhig tu skyes so //
analyzed: de de nas shi 'phos nas che ge mo zhig tu skyes so //
translated: Having passed away from there, I was reborn elsewhere.

original: de nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes so zhes de ltar rnam pa dang bcas /
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes so zhes de ltar rnam pa dang bcas /
translated: Having passed away from there, I was reborn here.’ Thus he recollects his various previous abodes with their aspects and details.”

original: yul phyogs dang bcas par bdag dang / sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan rnams kyi sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma dag rjes su dran la /
analyzed: yul phyogs dang bcas par bdag dang / sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan rnams kyi sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma dag rjes su dran la /
translated: together with the region, he recollects his own and other beings’ and other persons’ various former abodes.

original: mngon par shes pa des kyang rlom sems su mi byed pa'i bar du ste /🔽rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' @28a *//
analyzed: mngon par shes pa des kyang rlom sems su mi byed pa'i bar du ste / rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' @28a *//
translated: And he does not, on account of that knowledge, become proud.

original: sems dpa' chen po'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, that is called the bodhisattva great beings’ purity of the knowledge of former existences clairvoyance.

original: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i zag pa zad pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i zag pa zad pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, what is the bodhisattva great beings’ purity of the knowledge of the clairvoyance that realizes the extinction of defilements?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of wisdom

original: zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa mngon par bsgrub kyang nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa mngon par bsgrub kyang nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: They may accomplish the supernormal knowledge of the knowledge of the extinction of defilements, yet they do not attain the level of the śrāvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'ang rjes su thob par mi byed la /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'ang rjes su thob par mi byed la /
translated: or the level of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i chos gang la'ang 'dod par mi byed cing /
analyzed: gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i chos gang la'ang 'dod par mi byed cing /
translated: They do not even aspire to any Dharma that would cause them to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: de mngon par shes pa des rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la brten nas /
analyzed: de mngon par shes pa des rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la brten nas /
translated: Through that supernormal knowledge, they may rely on the vajra-like meditative stabilization

original: bag chags dang mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spong bar byed mod kyi /
analyzed: bag chags dang mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spong bar byed mod kyi /
translated: and abandon all latent impulses and bonds.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa des kyang rlom sems su mi byed la /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa des kyang rlom sems su mi byed la /
translated: Yet, because of the emptiness of inherent existence, because of the isolation of inherent existence, and because of the non-apprehension of inherent existence, they do not even become conceited about that supernormal knowledge of the knowledge of the extinction of defilements.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa ma gtogs par sems kyang skyed par @28b mi byed de /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa ma gtogs par sems kyang skyed par @28b mi byed de /
translated: He does not even generate the mind of enlightenment except when he is attending to omniscience.

original: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i zag pa zad pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i zag pa zad pa mngon sum du bya ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pa yongs su dag par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: Subhūti, this is the bodhisattva great being’s purification of the clairvoyance that is the knowledge that realizes the destruction of the outflows.

original: 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'i mngon par shes pa drug po dag yongs su dag par byed pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'i mngon par shes pa drug po dag yongs su dag par byed pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: Subhūti, this is called the bodhisattva great being’s purification of the six clairvoyances while standing in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'ang go cha chen po yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'ang go cha chen po yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: And that should be known as the great armor.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Ten Thousand Lines,

original: mngon par shes pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bcu pa'o ////
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bcu pa'o ////
translated: this is the tenth chapter, “Clairvoyance.”

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i go cha chen po ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i go cha chen po ni /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being’s great armor

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: is as follows:

original: yongs su dag pa'i mig lnga ste /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i mig lnga ste /
translated: the five completely purified eyes.

original: lnga po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sha'i mig dang / lha'i mig dang / shes rab kyi mig dang / chos kyi mig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mig go /
analyzed: sha'i mig dang / lha'i mig dang / shes rab kyi mig dang / chos kyi mig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mig go /
translated: the fleshly eye, the divine eye, the eye of wisdom, the Dharma eye, and the buddha eye.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti asked him,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Reverend Lord!🔽What is the purified fleshly eye of bodhisattva great beings?🔽The Lord said, “Subhūti, there are bodhisattva great beings who with their fleshly eye see a hundred yojanas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sha'i mig yongs su dag pa gang lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sha'i mig yongs su dag pa gang lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: There are bodhisattva great beings who with their fleshly eye see two hundred yojanas.🔽There are bodhisattva great beings who with their fleshly eye see three hundred yojanas.🔽There are bodhisattva great beings who with their fleshly eye see four hundred yojanas.🔽There are bodhisattva great beings who with their fleshly eye see five hundred yojanas.🔽There are bodhisattva great beings who with their fleshly eye see a thousand yojanas.🔽There are bodhisattva great beings who with their fleshly eye see a thousand yojanas.🔽There are bodhisattva great beings who with their fleshly eye see two thousand yojanas.🔽There are bodhisattva great beings who with their fleshly eye see three thousand yojanas.🔽There are bodhisattva great beings who with their fleshly eye see four thousand yojanas.🔽There are bodhisattva great beings who with their fleshly eye see five thousand yojanas.🔽There are bodhisattva great beings who with their fleshly eye see a hundred thousand yojanas.🔽There are bodhisattva great beings who with their fleshly eye see a hundred thousand one hundred yojanas.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sha'i mig gis dpag tshad brgyar mthong ba'ang yod do //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sha'i mig gis dpag tshad @29a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sha'i mig gis dpag tshad brgyar mthong ba'ang yod do // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sha'i mig gis dpag tshad @29a *//
translated: There are bodhisattva great beings who with their fleshly eye see a hundred thousand two hundred yojanas.🔽There are bodhisattva great beings who with their fleshly eye see a hundred thousand three hundred yojanas.🔽There are bodhisattva great beings who with their fleshly eye see a hundred thousand four hundred yojanas.🔽There are bodhisattva great beings who with their fleshly eye see a hundred thousand five hundred yojanas.🔽There are bodhisattva great beings who with their fleshly eye see a hundred thousand one thousand yojanas.🔽There are bodhisattva great beings who with their fleshly eye see a hundred thousand two thousand yojanas.

original: nyis brgyar mthong ba'ang yod do //
analyzed: nyis brgyar mthong ba'ang yod do //
translated: There are bodhisattva great beings who with their fleshly eye see a hundred thousand three thousand yojanas.🔽There are bodhisattva great

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sha'i mig gis dpag tshad sum brgyar mthong ba'ang yod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sha'i mig gis dpag tshad sum brgyar mthong ba'ang yod do //
translated: There are also Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas who, with their fleshly eyes, can see up to three hundred yojanas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sha'i mig gis dpag tshad bzhi brgya dang / lnga brgya dang / drug brgyar mthong ba'ang yod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sha'i mig gis dpag tshad bzhi brgya dang / lnga brgya dang / drug brgyar mthong ba'ang yod do //
translated: There are also Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas who, with their fleshly eyes, can see up to four hundred, five hundred, or six hundred yojanas.

original: yang rab 'byor /
analyzed: yang rab 'byor /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sha'i mig gis dzambu gling gcig mthong ba'ang yod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sha'i mig gis dzambu gling gcig mthong ba'ang yod do //
translated: there are also Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas who, with their fleshly eyes, can see one Jambudvīpa.

original: yang rab 'byor /
analyzed: yang rab 'byor /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sha'i mig gis dzambu gling gnyis mthong ba nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sha'i mig gis dzambu gling gnyis mthong ba nas /
translated: there are also Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas who, with their fleshly eyes, can see two Jambudvīpas.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way,

original: sha'i mig gis gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gyi bar du mthong ba'ang yod do //
analyzed: sha'i mig gis gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gyi bar du mthong ba'ang yod do //
translated: there are also those who, with their fleshly eyes, can see up to a four-continent world system.

original: yang rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sha'i mig gis stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba'ang yod do //
analyzed: yang rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sha'i mig gis stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba'ang yod do //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, there are also Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas who, with their fleshly eyes, can see a thousand world systems.

original: yang rab 'byor /
analyzed: yang rab 'byor /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sha'i mig gis stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba'ang yod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sha'i mig gis stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba'ang yod do //
translated: there are bodhisattva great beings who see the world systems of the great trichiliocosm with their fleshly eyes.

original: yang rab 'byor /
analyzed: yang rab 'byor /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sha'i mig gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba'ang yod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sha'i mig gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mthong ba'ang yod do //
translated: there are bodhisattva great beings who see the world systems of the great trichiliocosm with their fleshly eyes.

original: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sha'i mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sha'i mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, that is the bodhisattva great beings’ pure fleshly eye.

original: gsol pa / @29b bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / @29b bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He said, “Blessed One,

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lha'i mig yongs su dag pa gang lags /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lha'i mig yongs su dag pa gang lags /
translated: what is the bodhisattva great beings’ pure divine eye?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rab tu shes so //
translated: “Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings know all the divine eyes of the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm.

original: de bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum rnams dang / 'thab bral rnams dang / dga' ldan rnams dang / 'phrul dga' rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum rnams dang / 'thab bral rnams dang / dga' ldan rnams dang / 'phrul dga' rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams nas /
translated: In the same way, the divine eye of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the gods of the Yāma Heaven, the gods of the Tuṣita Heaven, the gods of the Delighting in Creation Heaven, the gods of the Heaven of the Masters of Others’ Creations,

original: 'og min gyi bar gyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rab tu shes la /
analyzed: 'og min gyi bar gyi lha rnams kyi lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rab tu shes la /
translated: and the gods of the Akaniṣṭha Heaven is known by the bodhisattva great beings.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lha'i mig gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Su­bhūti, the divine eye of the bodhisattva great beings

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyis rab tu mi shes pa nas /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyis rab tu mi shes pa nas /
translated: is not known by the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm,

original: 'og min gyi bar gyi lha rnams kyis rab tu mi shes so //
analyzed: 'og min gyi bar gyi lha rnams kyis rab tu mi shes so //
translated: and is not known by the gods of the Akaniṣṭha realm.

original: yang rab 'byor /
analyzed: yang rab 'byor /
translated: Moreover, Su­bhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lha'i mig des shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sems can las ji ltar bsags pa rnams 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dag kyang mthong /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lha'i mig des shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sems can las ji ltar bsags pa rnams 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dag kyang mthong /
translated: With that divine eye, the bodhisattva mahāsattva sees the passing away and rebirth of beings in the eastern direction in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River.

original: kha dog bzang po rnams dang / kha dog ngan pa rnams dang / bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro dang / ngan pa dang / bar ma dang / gya nom pa dag kyang rab tu shes te /
analyzed: kha dog bzang po rnams dang / kha dog ngan pa rnams dang / bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro dang / ngan pa dang / bar ma dang / gya nom pa dag kyang rab tu shes te /
translated: He knows the good complexions and the bad complexions, the good rebirths and the bad rebirths, the bad, the middling, and the excellent.

original: kye ma sems @30a *//
analyzed: kye ma sems @30a *//
translated: “Alas!

original: can 'di dag ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: can 'di dag ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: These beings have physical misdeeds,

original: ngag gi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: ngag gi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: verbal misdeeds,

original: yid kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yid kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: and mental misdeeds.

original: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa 'debs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa 'debs pa /
translated: They slander the noble ones.

original: log par lta ba dang ldan pa dag yin te /
analyzed: log par lta ba dang ldan pa dag yin te /
translated: They have wrong views.

original: kye ma de dag ni log par lta ba yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen des lus zhig ste /
analyzed: kye ma de dag ni log par lta ba yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyu dang rkyen des lus zhig ste /
translated: Alas! Because of the cause and condition of taking up wrong views, when their bodies give out,

original: shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi nang du skyes so //
analyzed: shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal ba rnams kyi nang du skyes so //
translated: Translation: ཤི་བའི་འོག་ཏུ་ངན་སོང་ངན་འགྲོ་ལོག་པར་ལྟུང་བ་སེམས་ཅན་དམྱལ་བ་རྣམས་ཀྱི་ནང་དུ་སྐྱེས་སོ་ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ནས།

original: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni lus kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: Alas! These sentient beings are endowed with physical good conduct.🔽

original: ngag gi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: ngag gi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: He is endowed with good conduct of speech.🔽

original: yid kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa dag ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: yid kyi legs par spyod pa dang ldan pa dag ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: They are endowed with mental virtue.🔽

original: rgyu de dang rkyen de'i bar du ste /
analyzed: rgyu de dang rkyen de'i bar du ste /
translated: The interval between that cause and that condition is🔽

original: lus zhig nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skyes pa dang / de bzhin du phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi bar dag na sems can dag las ji ltar bsags pa bzhin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: lus zhig nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skyes pa dang / de bzhin du phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi bar dag na sems can dag las ji ltar bsags pa bzhin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: When their bodies disintegrate, they go to the happy realms and are born among the gods and humans.🔽🔽In the same way, in all the worlds in the ten directions, as many as there are sand particles in the Ganges River, sentient beings are born among the gods and humans in the happy realms and in the higher worlds, in accordance with their karma.

original: bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skyes so zhes bya ba'i bar du mthong ste /
analyzed: bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skyes so zhes bya ba'i bar du mthong ste /
translated: He sees that they have been born among the gods and humans of the higher realms of happy rebirth.🔽

original: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lha'i mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lha'i mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: This, Subhuti, is the pure divine eye of the Bodhisattva, the great being.

original: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi mig yongs @30b su dag pa de gang lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi mig gang gis 'di snyam du gang 'dus byas sam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi mig yongs @30b su dag pa de gang lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi mig gang gis 'di snyam du gang 'dus byas sam /
translated: is the eye of wisdom of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, pure?

original: 'dus ma byas sam /🔽'jig rten pa'am /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas sam / 'jig rten pa'am /
translated: The Lord: When the Bodhisattva, the great being, through the eye of wisdom has this thought, 'there is no dharma which is compounded or uncompounded,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'am /
translated: mundane or supramundane,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'am /🔽zag pa med pa'i chos gang yang yod do snyam du mi sems pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi mig gang gis gang ma mthong ba'am /🔽mthos pa'am / mi dran pa'am /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'am / zag pa med pa'i chos gang yang yod do snyam du mi sems pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi mig gang gis gang ma mthong ba'am / mthos pa'am / mi dran pa'am /
translated: with or without outflows,🔽which he does not see, or which he sees, or which he does not know or does not cognize.'

original: rnam par ma shes pa'i chos gang yang med de /
analyzed: rnam par ma shes pa'i chos gang yang med de /
translated: And again, Subhuti, the eye of wisdom of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, is so pure that there is no dharma which it does not see, or which it sees, or which it does not know or does not cognize.

original: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: is the eye of the Tathagata defiled or is it undefiled?

original: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti,🔽is the eye of the Tathagata defiled or is it undefiled?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti,🔽is the eye of the Tathagata defiled or is it undefiled?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa gang lags /
translated: is the eye of the Tathagata defiled or is it undefiled?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti,🔽is the eye of the Tathagata defiled or is it undefiled?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti,🔽is the eye of the Tathagata defiled or is it undefiled?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig gis 'di ltar shes te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig gis 'di ltar shes te /
translated: The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti,

original: gang zag 'di ni dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'o //🔽'di ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //🔽'di ni stong pa nyid la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag 'di ni dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'o // 'di ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o // 'di ni stong pa nyid la gnas pa'o //
translated: is the eye of the Tathagata defiled or is it undefiled?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti,🔽is the eye of the Tathagata defiled or is it undefiled?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti,🔽is the eye of the Tathagata defiled or is it undefiled?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti,

original: 'di ni mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: is the eye of the Tathagata defiled or is it undefiled?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti,🔽is the eye of the Tathagata defiled or is it undefiled?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti,

original: 'di ni smon pa med pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni smon pa med pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: is the eye of the Tathagata defiled or is it undefiled?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti,🔽is the eye of the Tathagata defiled or is it undefiled?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti,

original: gang zag 'di ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam par thar pa'i sgos dbang po lnga po dag bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag 'di ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam par thar pa'i sgos dbang po lnga po dag bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: is the eye of the Tathagata defiled or is it undefiled?

original: de'i @31a *// 'og tu dbang po lnga po dag gis bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i @31a *// 'og tu dbang po lnga po dag gis bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, through the five faculties, one will reach the uninterrupted samādhi.

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las rnam par grol ba'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las rnam par grol ba'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From the uninterrupted samādhi, the knowledge of liberation will arise.

original: de nas rnam par grol ba'i shes pas kun tu sbyor pa gsum po dag spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas rnam par grol ba'i shes pas kun tu sbyor pa gsum po dag spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, through the knowledge of liberation, one will abandon the three fetters.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang; the tshom dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang; the tshom dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
translated: the view of the transitory collection, doubt, and holding a discipline and ritual to be paramount.

original: kun tu sbyor ba gsum po de dag spangs pas rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba gsum po de dag spangs pas rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: By abandoning these three fetters, one is called a stream enterer.

original: des bsgom pa'i lam thob nas 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / gnod sems gnyis srab mor byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des bsgom pa'i lam thob nas 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / gnod sems gnyis srab mor byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Having attained the path of cultivation, one will weaken desire and ill will.

original: de ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba yin no //
translated: This is a once-returner.

original: des bsgom pa'i lam cher bsgoms pa de nyid kyis 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / gnod sems gnyis ma lus par spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des bsgom pa'i lam cher bsgoms pa de nyid kyis 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / gnod sems gnyis ma lus par spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By cultivating that path of cultivation to a high degree, he abandons desire and malice in their entirety.

original: des de gnyis spangs pas phyir mi 'ong ba yin no //
analyzed: des de gnyis spangs pas phyir mi 'ong ba yin no //
translated: By abandoning those two, he becomes a non-returner.

original: des bsgom pa'i lam cher bsgoms pa de nyid kyis gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun tu sbyor ba lnga spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des bsgom pa'i lam cher bsgoms pa de nyid kyis gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun tu sbyor ba lnga spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: By cultivating that path of cultivation to a still higher degree, he abandons the five fetters that are specific to the upper realms.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dang / ma rig pa dang / nga rgyal dang / rgod pa ste /🔽des de dag spangs pas dgra bcom par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / gang zag 'di ni mtshan ma med pa'i @31b rnam par thar pa'i sgos dbang po lnga po dag bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dang / ma rig pa dang / nga rgyal dang / rgod pa ste / des de dag spangs pas dgra bcom par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / gang zag 'di ni mtshan ma med pa'i @31b rnam par thar pa'i sgos dbang po lnga po dag bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: desire for the form realm, desire for the formless realm, ignorance, conceit, and restlessness.🔽By abandoning those, he becomes an arhat.🔽This person generates the five faculties through the liberation that is signless.

original: de nas dngang po lnga po dag gis bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas dngang po lnga po dag gis bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, by means of those five, he touches the meditative absorption that is without impediment.

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las rnam par grol ba'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las rnam par grol ba'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, from the uninterrupted samādhi, the cognition of liberation arises.

original: de nas rnam par grol ba'i shes pas kun tu sbyor ba gsum po dag spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas rnam par grol ba'i shes pas kun tu sbyor ba gsum po dag spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, by the cognition of liberation, the three fetters are abandoned.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / the tshom dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / the tshom dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
translated: the view of the transitory collection, doubt, and holding a discipline and ritual to be paramount.

original: kun tu sbyor ba gsum po de dag spangs pas rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba gsum po de dag spangs pas rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: By abandoning those three fetters, one is called a stream-enterer.

original: des bsgom pa'i lam thob nas 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / gnod sems gnyis srab mor byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des bsgom pa'i lam thob nas 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / gnod sems gnyis srab mor byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Having attained the path of cultivation, attachment to the desire realm and malice become weak.

original: de ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba yin no //
translated: That is a once-returner.

original: des bsgom pa'i lam cher bsgoms pa de nyid kyis 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / gnod sems gnyis ma lus par spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des bsgom pa'i lam cher bsgoms pa de nyid kyis 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / gnod sems gnyis ma lus par spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By further cultivating that path of cultivation, attachment to the desire realm and malice are completely abandoned.

original: de gnyis spangs pas phyir mi 'ong ba yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis spangs pas phyir mi 'ong ba yin no //
translated: By abandoning those two, one is a non-returner.

original: des bsgom pa'i lam cher bsgoms pa de nyid kyis gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun tu sbyor ba lnga po dag spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des bsgom pa'i lam cher bsgoms pa de nyid kyis gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun tu sbyor ba lnga po dag spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: By cultivating that path of meditation to a high degree, he abandons the five fetters that are associated with the higher realms.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dang / ma rig pa dang / nga rgyal dang / rgod pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dang / ma rig pa dang / nga rgyal dang / rgod pa ste /
translated: the desire for the form realm, the desire for the formless realm, ignorance, pride, and restlessness.🔽By abandoning those, he becomes an arhat.

original: des de dag spangs pas dgra bcom par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / gang zag 'di ni smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgos dbang po lnga @32a *//🔽po dag bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des de dag spangs pas dgra bcom par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / gang zag 'di ni smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgos dbang po lnga @32a *// po dag bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: This person generates the five faculties through the gate of the liberation that is the wishless.

original: de nas dbang po lnga po dag gis bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas dbang po lnga po dag gis bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, through the five faculties, he touches the uninterrupted meditative stabilization.

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las rnam par grol ba'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las rnam par grol ba'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From the uninterrupted meditative stabilization, the knowledge of liberation arises.

original: de nas rnam par grol ba'i shes pas kun tu sbyor ba gsum po dag spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas rnam par grol ba'i shes pas kun tu sbyor ba gsum po dag spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, through the knowledge of liberation, he abandons the three fetters.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / the tshom dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / the tshom dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
translated: the view of the transitory collection, doubt, and the grasping of rules and ritual as emiment.

original: kun tu sbyor ba gsum po de dag spangs pas rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba gsum po de dag spangs pas rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: By abandoning these three fetters, one is called a stream-enterer.

original: des bsgom pa'i lam thob nas 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / gnod sems gnyis srab mor byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des bsgom pa'i lam thob nas 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / gnod sems gnyis srab mor byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Having attained the path of cultivation, the two desires for sensual pleasure and malice become weak.

original: de ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba yin no //
translated: One is a once-returner.

original: des bsgom pa'i lam cher bsgoms pa de nyid kyis 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / gnod sems de gnyis ma lus par spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des bsgom pa'i lam cher bsgoms pa de nyid kyis 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / gnod sems de gnyis ma lus par spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By cultivating that path of cultivation even more, one abandons in their entirety the two desires for sensual pleasure and malice.

original: de gnyis ka spangs pas phyir mi 'ong ba yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ka spangs pas phyir mi 'ong ba yin no //
translated: By abandoning both of those, one is a non-returner.

original: des bsgom pa'i lam cher bsgoms pa de nyid kyis gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun tu sbyor ba lnga po dag spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des bsgom pa'i lam cher bsgoms pa de nyid kyis gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun tu sbyor ba lnga po dag spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: By cultivating that path of cultivation even more, one abandons the five fetters that are associated with the higher realms.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dang / ma rig pa dang / nga rgyal dang / rgod pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dang / ma rig pa dang / nga rgyal dang / rgod pa ste /
translated: the passion for form, the passion for the formless, ignorance, pride, and agitation.

original: des de dag spangs pas dgra bcom par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: des de dag spangs pas dgra bcom par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: By abandoning these, one becomes an arhat.

original: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems @32b dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems @32b dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, this is the purity of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's Dharma eye.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi tshe 'di ltar shes te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi tshe 'di ltar shes te /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, when the bodhisattva-mahāsattva knows thus:

original: kun 'byung ba'i chos gang ci'ang rung ba de thams cad ni 'gog pa'i chos can yin par rig nas /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i chos gang ci'ang rung ba de thams cad ni 'gog pa'i chos can yin par rig nas /
translated: Whatever phenomena arise, all of them are phenomena of cessation,

original: dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga 'thob ste /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga 'thob ste /
translated: he attains the five faculties beginning with faith.

original: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos kyi mig yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, this is the purity of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's Dharma eye.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi tshe 'di ltar shes te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi tshe 'di ltar shes te /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, when the bodhisattva-mahāsattva knows thus:🔽The eye is impermanent,🔽he does not apprehend the eye as permanent.

original: 'di ni sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yin te /
translated: This is a bodhisattva great being who has generated the first level of mind.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He practices the perfection of generosity, and so on up to🔽he practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de nas dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pas rtag tu lus bzang po yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de nas dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pas rtag tu lus bzang po yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, with the faculty of faith and the faculty of effort, endowed with skill in means, he always takes up a good body.
