translated: and likewise they do not grasp at feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, or consciousness.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein,

original: chos thams cad yongs su gzung ba ma mchis pa'i slad du gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad kyi bar du yongs su mi 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad yongs su gzung ba ma mchis pa'i slad du gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad kyi bar du yongs su mi 'dzin pa ni /
translated: Because all phenomena are ungraspable, they do not grasp any dhāraṇī gateways, up to and including all the gateways of meditative stability.

original: pha rol nas pha rol tu mchi ba ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis kyang rlom sems su mi bgyid lags so //
analyzed: pha rol nas pha rol tu mchi ba ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis kyang rlom sems su mi bgyid lags so //
translated: Because there is no going from one shore to the other, they do not even falsely project the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi nas /
analyzed: de ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi nas /
translated: They do not pass into nirvāṇa in the intermediate state without having completed the four establishments of mindfulness,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu nas /
translated: up to and including the noble eightfold path, and similarly, without having completed the ten powers of the tathāgatas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag yongs su ma rdzogs par bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' lags so //🔽de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag yongs su ma rdzogs par bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' lags so // de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: up to and including the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.🔽If you ask why, it is because they see the four establishments of mindfulness as not the four establishments of mindfulness,

original: 'di ltar dran pa nye bar bzhag pa de dag dran pa nye bar bzhag pa ma lags par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar dran pa nye bar bzhag pa de dag dran pa nye bar bzhag pa ma lags par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba nas /
translated: up to and including

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The same is to be applied to the other perfections.🔽

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ma lags par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i slad du ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ma lags par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba'i slad du ste /
translated: In the same vein, it is because they do not consider the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas to be the attributes of the buddhas.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gang gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin pa dang / de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su mi 'dzin pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gang gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin pa dang / de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su mi 'dzin pa nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: “This is the bodhisattva great beings’ non-apprehension of form, and similarly, their non-apprehension of feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness, and in the same vein,🔽their non-apprehension of , up to and including the dhāraṇī gateways and the gateways of meditative stability,

original: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad kyi bar @43b du yongs su mi 'dzin pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams nas /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad kyi bar @43b du yongs su mi 'dzin pa dang / dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams nas /
translated: their non-apprehension of the applications of mindfulness,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and similarly, their non-apprehension of , up to and including the noble eightfold path, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, and in the same vein,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lags so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lags so //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not the apprehension of the eighteen distinct attributes of the Buddha.

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Venerable Transcendent Victor,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas 'di ltar nye bar brtag par bgyi ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas 'di ltar nye bar brtag par bgyi ste /
translated: furthermore, the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom should investigate thus:

original: kye shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni gang /🔽gang gis na 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin /
analyzed: kye shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni gang / gang gis na 'di shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin /
translated: ‘What is this perfection of wisdom?🔽By what is it the perfection of wisdom?

original: 'di gang gi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin /
analyzed: 'di gang gi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin /
translated: Whose is this perfection of wisdom?

original: 'di ci'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brtag par bgyi ste /
analyzed: 'di ci'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brtag par bgyi ste /
translated: For what reason is it called the perfection of wisdom?’

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na'ang 'di snyam du chos gang yang med cing mi dmigs pa de ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na'ang 'di snyam du chos gang yang med cing mi dmigs pa de ni /
translated: When the bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the perfection of wisdom, he thinks, ‘Any dharma that does not exist and is not apprehended,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o snyam du nges par sems par bgyid do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o snyam du nges par sems par bgyid do //
translated: It is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus /
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatīputra

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said to the venerable Su­bhūti,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Su­bhūti,

original: chos med cing mi dmigs pa gang yin; smras pa /🔽nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / phyi stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / chen po stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / don dam pa @44a *//
analyzed: chos med cing mi dmigs pa gang yin; smras pa / nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / phyi stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / chen po stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / don dam pa @44a *//
translated: what are those phenomena that do not exist and are not apprehended?”

original: stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, they are the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end,

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang /
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang /
translated: Because of the emptiness that is nothing to be discarded,🔽because of the emptiness of nature, because of the emptiness of specific characteristics, because of the emptiness of all phenomena, because of the emptiness of nonapprehension,

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: because of the emptiness of things, because of the emptiness of essential nature, and because of the emptiness of the essential nature of nonthings,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos ni med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos ni med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: the phenomena of the perfection of wisdom do not exist and are not apprehended.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: the phenomena of the perfection of concentration, the phenomena of the perfection of perseverance, and, Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de bzhin du bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos ni med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos ni med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: Similarly, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity are non-existent and non-apprehensible.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽gzhan yang nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / gzhan yang nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,🔽Furthermore, form is non-existent and non-apprehensible because of the emptiness of internal phenomena, and in the same vein as before,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir gzugs med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir gzugs med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: up to because of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa med @44b cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa med @44b cing mi dmigs so //
translated: Similarly, feeling, notion, co-producing factors, and consciousness are non-existent and non-apprehensible.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: nang stong pa nyid kyang med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyang med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena is non-existent and non-apprehensible.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein as before,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is non-existent and not apprehended.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: the applications of mindfulness are non-existent and not apprehended.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu nas /
translated: In the same vein,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: up to the noble eightfold path, and the ten powers of the tathāgatas, up to and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas are non-existent and not apprehended.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: mngon par shes pa drug med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: the six superknowledges are non-existent and not apprehended.

original: de bzhin nyid med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: Suchness is non-existent and not apprehended.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar du med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar du med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: the intrinsic nature of phenomena, the abiding nature of phenomena, the infallible nature of phenomena, up to the very limit of reality are non-existent and not apprehended.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa med cing mi dmigs pa nas /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa med cing mi dmigs pa nas /
translated: The stream enterer is non-existent and not apprehended,

original: dgra bcom pa'i bar du med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i bar du med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: up to the arhat is nonexistent and non-apprehensible.

original: rang sangs rgyas med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: A pratyekabuddha is nonexistent and non-apprehensible.

original: byang chub sems dpa' med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: A bodhisattva is nonexistent and non-apprehensible.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: a buddha is nonexistent and non-apprehensible.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: the knowledge of all aspects is nonexistent and non-apprehensible.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom

original: @45a *// de ltar nye bar rtog par byed cing /🔽nges par sems par byed la /
analyzed: @45a *// de ltar nye bar rtog par byed cing / nges par sems par byed la /
translated: they should investigate in that way

original: de ltar nye bar rtog par byed cing /
analyzed: de ltar nye bar rtog par byed cing /
translated: and reflect in that way.🔽When they investigate in that way

original: de ltar nges par sems pa na /🔽gal te sems mi zhum mi 'gong la /
analyzed: de ltar nges par sems pa na / gal te sems mi zhum mi 'gong la /
translated: and reflect in that way,🔽if their minds do not become cowed, crushed, or timid,

original: mi skrag mi dngang zhing dngang bar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: mi skrag mi dngang zhing dngang bar mi 'gyur na /
translated: if they are not afraid, terrified, or filled with dread,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that this bodhisattva mahāsattva is not separated from the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus /
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatī­putra

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Su­bhūti,

original: ci'i phyir na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar rig par bya /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar rig par bya /
translated: why should one know that the bodhisattva mahāsattva is not separated from the perfection of wisdom?”

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: The venerable Su­bhūti then replied to the venerable Śāradvatī­putra as follows:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatī­putra,

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang bral ba ste /
translated: form is devoid of the intrinsic nature of form.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: When bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows it just as it is.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba ste /
translated: in the same way, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are devoid of the nature of consciousness.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: That is known by the bodhisattva mahāsattvas just as it is.

original: tshe @45b dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe @45b dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: in the same way, the perfection of generosity, the perfection of good conduct, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba ste /
translated: and the perfection of wisdom are devoid of the nature of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: That is the correct understanding of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein, as before,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar ni yang dag pa'i mtha'i rang bzhin dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dang / yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar ni yang dag pa'i mtha'i rang bzhin dang bral ba ste /
translated: up to and including the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, and the very limit of reality, are devoid of the very limit of reality.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: That is the correct understanding of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so; ;tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so; ;tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: rgyu des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral bar rig par bya'o //
translated: for that reason it should be known that the bodhisattva great beings are not separated from the perfection of wisdom.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang; tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang; tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When this had been said, the venerable Śāradvatīputra said to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Su­bhūti,

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin gang yin /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin gang yin /
translated: What is the intrinsic nature of form?

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams kyi rang bzhin gang yin /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams kyi rang bzhin gang yin /
translated: What is the intrinsic nature of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness?

original: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gang yin /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gang yin /
translated: What is the intrinsic nature of consciousness?

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar gyi rang @46a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te / yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar gyi rang @46a *//
translated: in the same vein,

original: bzhin gang yin /
analyzed: bzhin gang yin /
translated: what is the intrinsic nature of , up to and including the very limit of reality?

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so // tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāradvatī­putra,

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: the intrinsic nature of form is non-entity.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the intrinsic nature of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is non-entity.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar gyi rang bzhin ni dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar gyi rang bzhin ni dngos po med pa'o //
translated: the intrinsic nature of , up to and including the very limit of reality, is non-entity.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatī­putra,

original: rnam grangs des na 'di ltar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na 'di ltar rig par bya ste /
translated: For this reason, it should be understood as follows:

original: ji ltar gzugs gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang bral ba de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba nas /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang bral ba de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba nas /
translated: Just as form is devoid of the intrinsic nature of form, so feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are devoid of the intrinsic nature of consciousness.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way, connect this with each,🔽up to thusness is devoid of the intrinsic nature of thusness,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar ni yang dag pa'i mtha'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar ni yang dag pa'i mtha'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba /
translated: and the characteristic is devoid of the intrinsic nature of the characteristic,

original: mtshan nyid kyang rang bzhin dang bral ba yin la /🔽rang bzhin yang mtshan nyid dang bral bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyang rang bzhin dang bral ba yin la / rang bzhin yang mtshan nyid dang bral bar rig par bya'o //
translated: and the intrinsic nature is devoid of the intrinsic nature of the characteristic.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Śāriputra asked the Lord, “Lord, if all dharmas are empty, devoid of intrinsic nature, isolated, insubstantial, and like a dream, etc., how, Lord, do these beings who are in the process of being reborn in the five places of rebirth, who are in the process of being reborn in the five destinies, who are in the process of being reborn in the five classes of living beings, come to be reborn in the hells, or as animals, or as ghosts, or as gods, or as humans, or as desire gods?🔽“Lord, how do they come to be reborn in the first concentration, or in the second, or in the third, or in the fourth concentration?🔽How do they come to be reborn in the sphere of infinite space, or in the sphere of infinite consciousness, or in the sphere of nothingness, or in the sphere of neither perception nor nonperception?

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: How do they come to be reborn in the summit of existence?🔽How do they come to be reborn in the formless realm?🔽How do they come to be reborn in the form realm?🔽How do they come to be reborn in the desire realm?🔽How do they come to be reborn in the desire realm, or in the form realm, or in the formless realm?🔽How do they come to be reborn in the world system of desire, or in the world system of form, or in the world system of the formless?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bslab pa 'di la slob pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bslab pa 'di la slob pa de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: “Those bodhisattva great beings who train in this training will they go forth to the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan @46b pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan @46b pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāriputra,

analyzed: de de bzhin no //
translated: it is so, it is so.

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you say.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bslab pa 'di la slob pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang bslab pa 'di la slob pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings who train in this training will go forth to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: chos thams cad ni ma skyes shing nges par 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ma skyes shing nges par 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is because all dharmas are not produced and do not go forth.”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Śāriputra asked, “Venerable Subhūti,

analyzed: ci'i phyir chos thams cad ma skyes shing nges par 'byung ba med pa yin /

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong ste /
translated: form is empty of form.

original: de la ni skyes pa'ang med cing byung ba'ang dmigs su med do //
analyzed: de la ni skyes pa'ang med cing byung ba'ang dmigs su med do //
translated: There is no arising and no origination to be apprehended.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: Similarly, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty of the intrinsic nature of consciousness.

original: de la ni skyes pa'ang med cing byung ba'ang dmigs su med do //
analyzed: de la ni skyes pa'ang med cing byung ba'ang dmigs su med do //
translated: There is no arising and no origination to be apprehended.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way, connect this with each, up to

original: yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar ni yang dag pa'i mtha'i rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha'i bar ni yang dag pa'i mtha'i rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: the very limit of reality is empty of the intrinsic nature of the very limit of reality.

original: de la ni skyes pa'ang med cing byung ba'ang dmigs su med do //
analyzed: de la ni skyes pa'ang med cing byung ba'ang dmigs su med do //
translated: There is no arising and no origination to be apprehended.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Ten Thousand Lines,

analyzed: mi gnas pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bcu gcig pa'o ////

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la /

translated: said to the venerable Subhūti:🔽“Subhūti,

analyzed: la spyod na /

analyzed: de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so //

analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la spyod na /

analyzed: de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so // yang gal te gzugs la rtag ces bgyi ba'am /
translated: that is practicing a causal sign.🔽“Moreover, if they practice form as permanent

analyzed: mi rtag ces bgyi bar spyod na /

original: de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so //
analyzed: de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so //
translated: that is practicing a causal sign.

analyzed: de bzhin du gal te tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang; 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la rtag ces bgyi ba'am /

analyzed: mi rtag ces bgyi bar spyod na /

analyzed: de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so // de bzhin du gal te gzugs la bde zhes bgyi ba'am /

analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bgyi bar spyod na /

analyzed: de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so //

analyzed: de bzhin du gal te tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la bde zhes bgyi ba'am /

translated: that is to say, they are practicing with signs.🔽If they practice with regard to physical forms, thinking that they are a self

analyzed: bdag ma mchis zhes bgyi bar spyod na /
translated: or that they are not a self,

original: de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so //
analyzed: de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so //
translated: that is to say, they are practicing with signs.

original: de bzhin du gal te tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la bdag mchis zhes bgyi ba'am /

analyzed: mi stong zhes bgyi bar spyod na de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so //
translated: or that they are not empty, that is to say, they are practicing with signs.

analyzed: mtshan ma ma mchis zhes bgyi bar spyod na /

original: smon pa ma mchis zhes bgyi bar spyod na de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so //
analyzed: smon pa ma mchis zhes bgyi bar spyod na de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so //
translated: or that they are wishless, one is engaging with a sign.

analyzed: ma zhi zhes bgyi bar spyod na /
translated: or that it is not calm,

original: de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so //
analyzed: de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so //

analyzed: ma zhi zhes bgyi bar spyod na /

analyzed: de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so // gal te gzugs la dben zhes bgyi ba'am /

original: mi dben zhes bgyi bar spyod na /
analyzed: mi dben zhes bgyi bar spyod na /
translated: or that it is not secluded,

original: de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so //
analyzed: de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so //
translated: that would be to practice with signs.

analyzed: de bzhin du gal te tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed @48a *//
translated: Similarly, if one were to practice with the idea that feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are secluded,🔽or that they are not secluded,🔽that would be to practice with signs.

translated: purified,

analyzed: de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so // de bzhin du gal te tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la kun nas nyon mongs zhes bgyi ba'am /
translated: then they are engaging in a sign.🔽Similarly, if they engage with the notion that feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are afflicted or

translated: purified,

analyzed: de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so // gal te gzugs la skye zhes bgyi ba'am /
translated: then they are engaging in a sign.🔽If they engage with the notion that form arises or

analyzed: mi skye zhes bgyi bar spyod na /
translated: ceases,

original: de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so //
analyzed: de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so //

analyzed: de bzhin du gal te tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la skye zhes bgyi ba'am /

translated: If they practice in terms of ‘existence’ or ‘non-existence’ with regard to form,🔽then they are practicing with signs.

analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /

analyzed: de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so // de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: then they are practicing with signs.🔽In the same way, if they practice up to the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas,

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la spyod na; de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so //
translated: then they are practicing with signs.

translated: “Reverend Lord! If a great bodhisattva being who practices the transcendent perfection of wisdom thinks, ‘I am practicing the transcendent perfection of wisdom,

original: de bsgom par bya'o snyam na /
analyzed: de bsgom par bya'o snyam na /

analyzed: de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so // gal te 'di snyam du sems te / bdag ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: then he is practicing a sign.🔽If he thinks, ‘I am a bodhisattva,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'o snyam na /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'o snyam na /
translated: and this is a bodhisattva,’

original: de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so //
analyzed: de ni mtshan ma la spyod pa lags so //
translated: then he is practicing a sign.
