translated: the samādhi called Great Array, the samādhi called Illuminating All Worlds, the samādhi called Equality of Samādhis, the samādhi called Free of Dust and Free of Attachment,

original: bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa thams cad yang dag par 'du ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / g-yo ba med cing gnas pa med la dga' ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa thams cad yang dag par 'du ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / g-yo ba med cing gnas pa med la dga' ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: the samādhi called Gathering All That Is Defiled and Undefiled, the samādhi called Without Movement or Resting and Delightful,

original: de bzhin nyid la gnas shing sems med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / lus kyi skyon yang dag par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / ngag gi skyon rnam par 'jig pas nam mkha' ltar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la gnas shing sems med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / lus kyi skyon yang dag par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / ngag gi skyon rnam par 'jig pas nam mkha' ltar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: the meditative absorption called abiding in suchness and being without mind, the meditative absorption called eliminating the faults of the body, the meditative absorption called becoming like space through the destruction of the faults of speech,

original: nam mkha' ltar chags pa med la 'gro ba las rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod de /
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar chags pa med la 'gro ba las rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin yod de /
translated: the meditative absorption called being unattached like space, liberated from going and untainted,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gang dag la gnas na myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ting🔽nge 'dzin ni de dag yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gang dag la gnas na myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ting🔽nge 'dzin ni de dag yin no //
translated: these are the meditative absorptions of bodhisattva great beings, abiding in which they will quickly and fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the venerable Subhuti🔽

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the venerable Śāradvatīputra:🔽“Excellent, excellent, Śāradvatīputra!

original: aa la la de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang ting nge 'dzin 'di dag la gnas pa de ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis bla na med pa yang dag @56b par
analyzed: aa la la de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang ting nge 'dzin 'di dag la gnas pa de ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis bla na med pa yang dag @56b par
translated: In that case, Śāradvatīputra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who abides in these meditative stabilizations has been prophesied by the past tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas to unsurpassed,

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa yin la /
translated: perfect awakening.

original: da ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang dag 'tsho zhing bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: da ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang dag 'tsho zhing bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag kyang /
translated: And the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas who are alive at present in the world systems in the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the river Ganges,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la lung ston par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la lung ston par rig par bya ste /
translated: should be known as the tathāgatas who prophesy that bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing /
translated: He does not see any meditative stabilization at all.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag ni snyoms par ma zhugs pa dag go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag ni snyoms par ma zhugs pa dag go /
translated: “These bodhisattvas are not absorbed in meditative stabilization.

original: bdag ni snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: I am absorbed in meditative stabilization.

original: snyoms par 'jug go ;snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam du ting nge 'dzin de dag gis rlom sems su'ang mi byed la /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug go ;snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam du ting nge 'dzin de dag gis rlom sems su'ang mi byed la /
translated: I am absorbed in meditative stabilization. I will be absorbed in meditative stabilization.”

original: rnam par rtog pa de dag thams cad de la med cing mi 'byung ngo //🔽de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de dag thams cad de la med cing mi 'byung ngo // de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: All those thoughts do not exist for him, do not occur to him.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Śāriputra asked the Lord, “Lord, what is the name of this perfection of wisdom?🔽How should I address it?

original: ci ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / da ltar na phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
analyzed: ci ting nge 'dzin 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / da ltar na phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
translated: Lord, when bodhisattva great beings are practicing this deep perfection of wisdom, how far along the path should they be considered to have gone?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang dag 'tsho zhing bzhugs pa dag gis lung bstan par rig par bya'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang dag 'tsho zhing bzhugs pa dag gis lung bstan par rig par bya'am /
translated: or by the tathāgatas who are living, present, and teaching now?

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: they are not.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzhan zhig @57a *//
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang gzhan zhig @57a *//
translated: the perfection of wisdom is not one thing,

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams kyang gzhan la /
translated: the meditative stabilizations another,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang gzhan ma yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang gzhan ma yin gyi /
translated: and the bodhisattva great beings another.

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang ting nge 'dzin yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang ting nge 'dzin yin la /
translated: The bodhisattva is the meditative stabilization,

original: ting nge 'dzin nyid kyang byang chub sems dpa' yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin nyid kyang byang chub sems dpa' yin te /
translated: and the meditative stabilization is the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the bodhisattva, the meditative stabilization, and the perfection of wisdom are not two and are not divided.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Śāriputra then asked, “Venerable Subhūti,

original: gal te ting nge 'dzin kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: gal te ting nge 'dzin kyang gzhan la /
translated: if the meditative stabilization is not one thing and the perfection of wisdom another,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang gzhan ma yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva is also not something other than that.

original: ting nge 'dzin nyid kyang byang chub sems dpa' yin /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin nyid kyang byang chub sems dpa' yin /
translated: Samādhi itself is the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang ting nge 'dzin yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang ting nge 'dzin yin la /
translated: The bodhisattva itself is samādhi.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa de gnyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin na ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa de gnyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin na ni /
translated: If samādhi and the bodhisattva are the perfection of wisdom,

original: de ltar na ting nge 'dzin gyis chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du mi shes shing /
analyzed: de ltar na ting nge 'dzin gyis chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du mi shes shing /
translated: in that case, samādhi would not know the sameness of all phenomena.

original: kun tu shes pa med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun tu shes pa med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: It would also be without all-inclusive knowledge.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu; rnam grangs 'di nyid kyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ting nge 'dzin des chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid de mi shes shing /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu; rnam grangs 'di nyid kyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ting nge 'dzin des chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid de mi shes shing /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, by this very enumeration, the bodhisattva great being does not know the sameness of all phenomena through that samādhi.

original: kun tu shes pa'ang med do //
analyzed: kun tu shes pa'ang med do //
translated: He is also without all-inclusive knowledge.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: smras pa / byang chub sems dpa' de dang / ting nge 'dzin de dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de med pa nyid kyi phyir mi shes shing /
analyzed: smras pa / byang chub sems dpa' de dang / ting nge 'dzin de dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de med pa nyid kyi phyir mi shes shing /
translated: It was replied, “Because the bodhisattva, that meditative stabilization, and that perfection of wisdom do not exist, they are not known,

original: kun tu shes pa'ang med do //
analyzed: kun tu shes pa'ang med do //
translated: and they are not cognized at all.”

original: de nas @57b bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la legs so //🔽zhes bya ba byin te /🔽rab 'byor / legs so legs so //
analyzed: de nas @57b bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la legs so // zhes bya ba byin te / rab 'byor / legs so legs so //
translated: Then the Lord gave his approval to the venerable Su­bhūti:🔽“Excellent, Su­bhūti!🔽Excellent, Su­bhūti!

original: khyod kyi tshig 'di ni legs par smras so //
analyzed: khyod kyi tshig 'di ni legs par smras so //
translated: You have spoken well!

original: 'di ltar khyod ngas nyan thos nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa rnams kyi mchog tu bstan pa de la lung phog pa 'di ni khyod kyi tshul dang mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod ngas nyan thos nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa rnams kyi mchog tu bstan pa de la lung phog pa 'di ni khyod kyi tshul dang mthun pa yin te /
translated: In this way, I have also taught you, who have been declared to be the foremost of those disciples who abide without affliction, to be the one who has been prophesied. This is in accordance with your character.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattvas should also train in the perfection of wisdom in that way.”

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar bslab par bya'o //
translated: the perfection of meditative stability, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity.

original: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la de ltar bslab par bya ba nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la de ltar bslab par bya ba nas /
translated: Similarly, they should train in the applications of mindfulness,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and in the same vein, in , up to and including the noble eightfold path, and in the ten powers of the tathāgatas, and in the same vein,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la de ltar bslab par bya'o //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la de ltar bslab par bya'o // de nas bcom ldan 'das la /
translated: in , up to and including the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatī­putra asked the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Reverend Lord!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa legs sam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa legs sam /
translated: If bodhisattva great beings train like that, is it training in the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob na @58a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob na @58a *//
translated: if bodhisattva great beings train like that,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa yin te /
translated: they are training in the perfection of wisdom,

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob bo //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob bo //
translated: and that is training without apprehending anything.

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la slob pa yin zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la slob pa yin zhing /
translated: Similarly, they are training in the perfection of giving,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and in the same vein,

original: de ltar slob na dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi bar la slob pa yin pa nas /
analyzed: de ltar slob na dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi bar la slob pa yin pa nas /
translated: if they train like that, they are training in the applications of mindfulness, and so on, up to

original: de ltar slob na sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la slob pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar slob na sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la slob pa yin te /
translated: if they train like that, they are training in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob bo //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob bo //
translated: and that is training without apprehending anything.”🔽“Lord, if bodhisattva great beings train like that,🔽in what are they training?”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatī­putra said to the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Reverend Lord!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa lags shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa lags shing /
translated: When bodhisattva great beings train in that way, are they training in the transcendent perfection of wisdom,

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa lags sam /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa lags sam / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: and is that training also in the manner of not apprehending anything?”

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Śāradvatī­putra!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis slob pa yin no //
translated: When bodhisattva great beings train in that way, they are training in the transcendent perfection of wisdom in the manner of not apprehending anything.”

original: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra then asked, “Reverend Lord!

original: ci zhig mi dmigs lags /
analyzed: ci zhig mi dmigs lags /
translated: What is it that is not apprehended?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Śāradvatī­putra!

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir bdag mi dmigs /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir bdag mi dmigs /
translated: The self is not apprehended, because it is utterly pure.

original: sems can mi dmigs pa nas /
analyzed: sems can mi dmigs pa nas /
translated: Sentient beings are not apprehended,

original: shes pa po dang / mthong ba po'i bar du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shes pa po dang / mthong ba po'i bar du mi dmigs so //
translated: up to and including the one who knows and the one who sees.

original: de bzhin du shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir phung po rnams mi dmigs /🔽@58b khams rnams mi dmigs /
analyzed: de bzhin du shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir phung po rnams mi dmigs / @58b khams rnams mi dmigs /
translated: Likewise, because of being utterly pure, the aggregates are not apprehended,🔽the constituents are not apprehended,

original: skye mched rnams mi dmigs so //
analyzed: skye mched rnams mi dmigs so //
translated: and the sense fields are not apprehended.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ma rig pa mi dmigs pa nas /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ma rig pa mi dmigs pa nas /
translated: Because of being utterly pure, ignorance is not apprehended,

original: rga shi'i bar du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: rga shi'i bar du mi dmigs so //
translated: and so on up to: aging and death are not apprehended.

original: de bzhin du shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir sdug bsngal mi dmigs /
analyzed: de bzhin du shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir sdug bsngal mi dmigs /
translated: Likewise, because of being utterly pure, suffering is not apprehended,

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mi dmigs so //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mi dmigs so //
translated: and the origin of suffering, its cessation, and the path are not apprehended.

original: de bzhin du shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams mi dmigs; gzugs kyi khams mi dmigs /
analyzed: de bzhin du shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams mi dmigs; gzugs kyi khams mi dmigs /
translated: Likewise, because of being utterly pure, the desire realm is not apprehended, the form realm is not apprehended,

original: gzugs med pa'i khams mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams mi dmigs so //
translated: and the formless realm is not apprehended.

original: de bzhin du shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams mi dmigs pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams mi dmigs pa nas /
translated: Likewise, because of being utterly pure, the applications of mindfulness are not apprehended,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar du mi dmigs so //
translated: and so on up to: the eightfold noble path is not apprehended.

original: de bzhin du shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu mi dmigs pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu mi dmigs pa nas /
translated: Similarly, because of utter purity, the ten powers of the Tathāgata are non-apprehensible,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du mi dmigs so //
translated: and so are the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug mi dmigs so //
translated: Because of utter purity, the six perfections are non-apprehensible.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir rgyun du zhugs pa mi dmigs so //🔽de bzhin du shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir rgyun du zhugs pa mi dmigs so // de bzhin du shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa mi dmigs so //
translated: Because of utter purity, one who has entered the stream is non-apprehensible.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir rang sangs rgyas mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir rang sangs rgyas mi dmigs so //
translated: Similarly, because of utter purity, one who is tied to one more rebirth, one who is no longer subject to rebirth, one who is subject to only one more rebirth, a worthy one, and a pratyekabuddha are non-apprehensible.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs so //
translated: Because of utter purity, a bodhisattva is non-apprehensible.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa mi dmigs so //
translated: Because of utter purity, a tathāgata is non-apprehensible.

original: @59a *// de nas bcom ldan 'das la /
analyzed: @59a *// de nas bcom ldan 'das la /
translated: Then the Lord said to Śatakratu, head of the gods:🔽“So it is, Kauśika, so it is.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The venerable Śāradvatīputra then said:

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Venerable Transcendent Victor,🔽what is that purity?”

original: rnam par dag pa de gang lags bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa de gang lags bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Transcendent Victor said:

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / de bzhin du 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / chos thams cad mngon par 'du byed pa med pa de ni rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / de bzhin du 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / dmigs su med pa dang / chos thams cad mngon par 'du byed pa med pa de ni rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: “The non-arising of all phenomena, and similarly the non-cessation, the non-affliction, the non-purification, the non-appearance, the non-apprehension, and the non-conditioning of all phenomena—that is purity.”🔽Śāradvatīputra then said:

original: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Venerable Transcendent Victor,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob pa ni chos gang dag la bslabs pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob pa ni chos gang dag la bslabs pa lags /
translated: when bodhisattva-mahāsattvas train in that way, in which phenomena do they train?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Transcendent Victor said:

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob pa na chos gang dag la'ang bslabs pa med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar slob pa na chos gang dag la'ang bslabs pa med do //
translated: when bodhisattva-mahāsattvas train in that way, they do not train in any phenomena at all.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo 'di dag mngon par zhen pa de ltar chos 'di dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo 'di dag mngon par zhen pa de ltar chos 'di dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is because these phenomena do not exist as they are apprehended by foolish, ordinary beings.

original: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāriputra replied, “Lord,

original: ji ltar na chos 'di dag ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo 'di dag mngon par zhen pa de ltar ma mchis pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na chos 'di dag ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo 'di dag mngon par zhen pa de ltar ma mchis pa lags /
translated: how is it that these phenomena do not exist as they are apprehended by foolish, ordinary beings?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Śāriputra,

original: ji ltar med pa de ltar yod la /
analyzed: ji ltar med pa de ltar yod la /
translated: they exist in the way that they do not exist.

original: de ltar med pas ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar med pas ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they do not exist in that way, they are called ‘ignorance.’ ”

original: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāriputra asked, “Lord,

original: ci'i slad du de dag mchis pa @59b ma lags pa la ma rig pa zhes bgyi lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ci'i slad du de dag mchis pa @59b ma lags pa la ma rig pa zhes bgyi lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: why is it that what does not exist is called ‘ignorance’?”

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Śāriputra,

original: nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir gzugs med do //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir gzugs med do //
translated: form does not exist because of inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: de bzhin du nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa med do //
translated: Similarly, because of inner emptiness, up to because of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness do not exist.

original: de bzhin du nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: Similarly, because of inner emptiness, up to because of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, the applications of mindfulness do not exist and are not apprehended.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way,

original: nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du med na /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du med na /
translated: because of inner emptiness, up to because of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha do not exist.

original: de la byis pa so so'i skye bo ma rig pa dang sred ba'i dbang gis mngon par zhen pa de dag gis mngon par zhen nas yod pa ma yin pa la yod par brtags so //
analyzed: de la byis pa so so'i skye bo ma rig pa dang sred ba'i dbang gis mngon par zhen pa de dag gis mngon par zhen nas yod pa ma yin pa la yod par brtags so //
translated: There, those foolish, ordinary beings, through the power of ignorance and craving, conceive of what does not exist as existent.

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: They are:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus,

original: rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis la chags pas /
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis la chags pas /
translated: they are attached to the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.

original: de dag ni mi shes mi mthong ba ste /
analyzed: de dag ni mi shes mi mthong ba ste /
translated: They do not know and do not see.

original: chos gang dag med pa de dag la kun tu rtog par byed do //
analyzed: chos gang dag med pa de dag la kun tu rtog par byed do //
translated: They imagine those dharmas that do not exist.

original: brtags nas kyang ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa nas /🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: brtags nas kyang ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa nas / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Having imagined, they are attached to name-and-form.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la mngon par zhen to //
translated: In the same way, they are attached to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de dag mngon par zhen pa nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: de dag mngon par zhen pa nyid yin pas na /
translated: Because of that very attachment,

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams la yongs su rtog par byed pa'i phyir de @60a *//
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams la yongs su rtog par byed pa'i phyir de @60a *//
translated: they imagine non-existent dharmas.

original: dag ni mi shes mi mthong ba dag yin no //
analyzed: dag ni mi shes mi mthong ba dag yin no //
translated: Therefore, they do not know and do not see.

original: de dag ci zhig mi shes mi mthong zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ci zhig mi shes mi mthong zhe na /
translated: What is it that they do not know and do not see?

original: gzugs mi shes mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs mi shes mi mthong ngo //
translated: They do not know and do not see form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi shes mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi shes mi mthong ngo //
translated: In the same way, they do not know and do not see feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du mi shes mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du mi shes mi mthong ngo //
translated: up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: gang gi phyir mi shes shing mi mthong ba de'i phyir phyis pa so so'i skye bo rnams zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi shes shing mi mthong ba de'i phyir phyis pa so so'i skye bo rnams zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro'o //
translated: Because they do not know and do not see, they are called “ordinary folk.”

original: de dag ni nges par 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni nges par 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: They do not go forth.

original: gang nas nges par 'byung ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang nas nges par 'byung ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: From where do they not go forth?

original: 'dod pa'i khams nas nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams nas nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: They do not go forth from the desire realm.🔽They do not go forth from the form realm.

original: de bzhin du gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams nas nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams nas nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: They do not go forth from the formless realm.🔽They do not go forth to the qualities of the śrāvakas.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams su nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams su nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: They do not go forth to the qualities of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams su nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams su nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: They do not go forth to the qualities of the bodhisattvas.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams su nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams su nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: They do not go forth to the qualities of the genuinely perfect buddhas.

original: de dag ni yid mi ches pa dag yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni yid mi ches pa dag yin te /
translated: They are not trustworthy.

original: gzugs stong pa nyid du yid mi ches so //
analyzed: gzugs stong pa nyid du yid mi ches so //
translated: They do not believe that form is emptiness.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / 'du shes stong pa nyid dang / 'du byed rnams stong pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid du yid mi ches pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / 'du shes stong pa nyid dang / 'du byed rnams stong pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid du yid mi ches pa nas /
translated: They do not believe that feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness is emptiness.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar la'ang @60b yid mi ches so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar la'ang @60b yid mi ches so //
translated: They do not believe in the emptiness of the Buddha qualities.

original: yang de dag ni mi gnas pa dag yin te /
analyzed: yang de dag ni mi gnas pa dag yin te /
translated: “Moreover, they are not established.

original: gang la mi gnas she na /
analyzed: gang la mi gnas she na /
translated: In what are they not established?

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi gnas pa nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi gnas pa nas /
translated: They are not established in the perfection of giving.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la mi gnas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la mi gnas so //
translated: They are not established in the perfection of wisdom.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la mi gnas shing /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la mi gnas shing /
translated: They are not established in the irreversible stage.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la mi gnas te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la mi gnas te /
translated: They are not established in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rgyu des na byis pa so so'i skye bo zhes bya /
analyzed: rgyu des na byis pa so so'i skye bo zhes bya /
translated: For that reason they are called ‘foolish ordinary persons.’

original: mngon par zhen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called ‘those who are attached.’

original: ci zhig la mngon par zhen pa yin zhing de dag gang la mngon par zhen pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig la mngon par zhen pa yin zhing de dag gang la mngon par zhen pa yin zhe na /
translated: What are they attached to? In what are they attached?

original: gzugs la mngon par zhen pa nas /
analyzed: gzugs la mngon par zhen pa nas /
translated: They cling to form,

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar la mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar la mngon par zhen to //
translated: and so on up to consciousness.

original: de bzhin du mig la mngon par zhen pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig la mngon par zhen pa nas /
translated: They cling to the eyes,

original: de bzhin du yid kyi bar la mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi bar la mngon par zhen to //
translated: and so on up to the mind.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams la mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams la mngon par zhen to //
translated: They cling to forms, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and mental phenomena.

original: de bzhin du khams rnams la mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams rnams la mngon par zhen to //
translated: They cling to the elements.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams la mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams la mngon par zhen to //
translated: They cling to desire, anger, and ignorance.

original: lta bar gyur pa rnams la mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa rnams la mngon par zhen to //
translated: They cling to the views.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la mngon par zhen pa nas /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la mngon par zhen pa nas /
translated: They cling to the applications of mindfulness,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and so on up to

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la mngon par zhen to //
translated: the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, the venerable Śāriputra asked him,🔽“Lord, what is the bodhisattva great beings’ skill in means?

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /🔽byang chub sems dpa' de ltar slob na shes rab kyi @61a *//
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das / byang chub sems dpa' de ltar slob na shes rab kyi @61a *//
translated: Venerable Transcendent Victor,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ma lags shing /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ma lags shing /
translated: if bodhisattvas train like that, they do not train in the perfection of wisdom,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par mi 'byung ba lags mod /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par mi 'byung ba lags mod /
translated: and they will not go forth to the state of omniscience.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: The Transcendent Victor replied, “Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar slob pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar slob pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ma yin zhing /
translated: if bodhisattvas train like that, they do not train in the perfection of wisdom,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: and they will not go forth to the state of omniscience.

original: gsol pa; btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa; btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ” Śāriputra said, “Venerable Transcendent Victor,

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhig lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhig lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: then how is it?

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: ” The Transcendent Victor replied, “Śāriputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mi mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rtog par byed cing mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mi mkhas pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rtog par byed cing mngon par zhen to //
translated: here bodhisattva great beings, unskilled in means, imagine the perfection of wisdom and cling to it.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par rtog par byed cing mngon par zhen to //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin par rtog par byed cing mngon par zhen to // de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Similarly, they form mental constructs and fixate on the perfection of meditative stability, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of moral discipline, and the perfection of generosity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag tu rtog par byed cing mngon par zhen to //🔽mngon par zhen nas kyang thams cad shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du rtog par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag tu rtog par byed cing mngon par zhen to // mngon par zhen nas kyang thams cad shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du rtog par byed do //
translated: In the same vein, they form mental constructs and fixate on , up to and including the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.🔽Having fixated on them, they form mental constructs and fixate on the understanding of all things and the understanding of all aspects.

original: yongs su brtags nas kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mngon par zhen par byed de /🔽sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: yongs su brtags nas kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mngon par zhen par byed de / sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Having formed mental constructs and fixated on them, they fixate on omniscience.

original: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ma yin @61b zhing /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ma yin @61b zhing /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra, for these reasons great bodhisattva beings are not training in the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: they will not go forth to omniscience.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Śāradvatī­putra said to the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Reverend Lord!

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar slob na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ma lags shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar slob na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ma lags shing /
translated: If bodhisattvas train accordingly, they will not train in the transcendent perfection of wisdom,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba ma lags mod /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba ma lags mod / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: and they will not go forth to omniscience.”

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Śāradvatī­putra!

original: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ma yin zhing /
translated: If they train accordingly, bodhisattvas will not train in the transcendent perfection of wisdom,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: and they will not go forth to omniscience.”

original: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He continued, “Reverend Lord!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi zhing /
translated: How should bodhisattva great beings train in the perfection of wisdom?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji ltar slob na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji ltar slob na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung ba lags /
translated: How should bodhisattva great beings train so that they will go forth to the knowledge of all aspects?”
